midas/src/midas.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         MIDAS.C
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     MIDAS main library funcitons
00007 
00008   *** muCap patches ***
00009   - Changed hard-coded maximum event buffer size from 10 MB to 32 MB.
00010   - Set network send packet buffer size to NET_TCP_SIZE + 1 rather than 
00011     hardcoded 64 KB.
00012   - Change date handling in hs_open_file to be 64-bit clean.
00013 
00014   $Log: midas.c,v $
00015   Revision 1.2  2005/06/21 00:22:15  mucap
00016   (Fred)
00017     - Changed hard-coded maximum event buffer size from 10 MB to 32 MB.
00018     - Set network send packet buffer size to NET_TCP_SIZE + 1 rather than
00019       hardcoded 64 KB.
00020     - Change date handling in hs_open_file to be 64-bit clean.

00747 /********************************************************************/
00748 /* data type sizes */
00749 INT tid_size[] = {
00750    0,                           /* tid == 0 not defined                               */
00751    1,                           /* TID_BYTE      unsigned byte         0       255    */
00752    1,                           /* TID_SBYTE     signed byte         -128      127    */
00753    1,                           /* TID_CHAR      single character      0       255    */
00754    2,                           /* TID_WORD      two bytes             0      65535   */
00755    2,                           /* TID_SHORT     signed word        -32768    32767   */
00756    4,                           /* TID_DWORD     four bytes            0      2^32-1  */
00757    4,                           /* TID_INT       signed dword        -2^31    2^31-1  */
00758    4,                           /* TID_BOOL      four bytes bool       0        1     */
00759    4,                           /* TID_FLOAT     4 Byte float format                  */
00760    8,                           /* TID_DOUBLE    8 Byte float format                  */
00761    1,                           /* TID_BITFIELD  8 Bits Bitfield    00000000 11111111 */
00762    0,                           /* TID_STRING    zero terminated string               */
00763    0,                           /* TID_ARRAY     variable length array of unkown type */
00764    0,                           /* TID_STRUCT    C structure                          */
00765    0,                           /* TID_KEY       key in online database               */
00766    0                            /* TID_LINK      link in online database              */
00767 };
00768 
00769 /* data type names */
00770 char *tid_name[] = {
00771    "NULL",
00772    "BYTE",
00773    "SBYTE",
00774    "CHAR",
00775    "WORD",
00776    "SHORT",
00777    "DWORD",
00778    "INT",
00779    "BOOL",
00780    "FLOAT",
00781    "DOUBLE",
00782    "BITFIELD",
00783    "STRING",
00784    "ARRAY",
00785    "STRUCT",
00786    "KEY",
00787    "LINK"
00788 };
00789

00791    int transition;
00792    char name[32];
00793 } trans_name[] = {
00794    {TR_START, "START",}, 
00795    {TR_STOP, "STOP",}, 
00796    {TR_PAUSE, "PAUSE",}, 
00797    {TR_RESUME, "RESUME",}, 
00798    {TR_DEFERRED, "DEFERRED",},
00799 };

00855    {0}
00856 };

00864 typedef struct {
00865    INT code;
00866    char *string;
00867 } ERROR_TABLE;
00868 
00869 ERROR_TABLE _error_table[] = {
00870    {CM_WRONG_PASSWORD, "Wrong password"},
00871    {CM_UNDEF_EXP, "Experiment not defined"},
00872    {CM_UNDEF_ENVIRON,
00873     "\"exptab\" file not found and MIDAS_DIR environment variable not defined"},
00874    {RPC_NET_ERROR, "Cannot connect to remote host"},
00875    {0, NULL}
00876 };
00877 
00878 
00879 typedef struct {
00880    void *adr;
00881    int size;
00882    char file[80];
00883    int line;
00884 } DBG_MEM_LOC;
00885 
00886 DBG_MEM_LOC *_mem_loc = NULL;
00887 INT _n_mem = 0;
00888 
00889 void *dbg_malloc(unsigned int size, char *file, int line)
00890 {
00891    FILE *f;
00892    void *adr;
00893    int i;
00894 
00895    adr = malloc(size);
00896 
00897    /* search for deleted entry */
00898    for (i = 0; i < _n_mem; i++)
00899       if (_mem_loc[i].adr == NULL)
00900          break;
00901 
00902    if (i == _n_mem) {
00903       _n_mem++;
00904       if (!_mem_loc)
00905          _mem_loc = (DBG_MEM_LOC *) malloc(sizeof(DBG_MEM_LOC));
00906       else
00907          _mem_loc = (DBG_MEM_LOC *) realloc(_mem_loc, sizeof(DBG_MEM_LOC) * _n_mem);
00908    }
00909 
00910    _mem_loc[i].adr = adr;
00911    _mem_loc[i].size = size;
00912    strcpy(_mem_loc[i].file, file);
00913    _mem_loc[i].line = line;
00914 
00915    f = fopen("mem.txt", "w");
00916    for (i = 0; i < _n_mem; i++)
00917       if (_mem_loc[i].adr)
00918          fprintf(f, "%s:%d size=%d adr=%X\n", _mem_loc[i].file, _mem_loc[i].line,
00919                  _mem_loc[i].size, (unsigned int) _mem_loc[i].adr);
00920    fclose(f);
00921 
00922    return adr;
00923 }
00924 
00925 void *dbg_calloc(unsigned int size, unsigned int count, char *file, int line)
00926 {
00927    void *adr;
00928 
00929    adr = dbg_malloc(size * count, file, line);
00930    if (adr)
00931       memset(adr, 0, size * count);
00932 
00933    return adr;
00934 }
00935 
00936 void dbg_free(void *adr, char *file, int line)
00937 {
00938    FILE *f;
00939    int i;
00940 
00941    free(adr);
00942 
00943    for (i = 0; i < _n_mem; i++)
00944       if (_mem_loc[i].adr == adr)
00945          break;
00946 
00947    if (i < _n_mem)
00948       _mem_loc[i].adr = NULL;
00949 
00950    f = fopen("mem.txt", "w");
00951    for (i = 0; i < _n_mem; i++)
00952       if (_mem_loc[i].adr)
00953          fprintf(f, "%s:%d size=%d adr=%X\n", _mem_loc[i].file, _mem_loc[i].line,
00954                  _mem_loc[i].size, (unsigned int) _mem_loc[i].adr);
00955    fclose(f);
00956 
00957 }
00958 
00959 
00960 /********************************************************************\
00961 *                                                                    *
00962 *              Common message functions                              *
00963 *                                                                    *
00964 \********************************************************************/
00965 
00966 static int (*_message_print) (const char *) = puts;
00967 static INT _message_mask_system = MT_ALL;
00968 static INT _message_mask_user = MT_ALL;
00969 
00970 
00972 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
00973 
00979 /********************************************************************/
00987 INT cm_get_error(INT code, char *string)
00988 {
00989    INT i;
00990 
00991    for (i = 0; _error_table[i].code; i++)
00992       if (_error_table[i].code == code) {
00993          strcpy(string, _error_table[i].string);
00994          return CM_SUCCESS;
00995       }
00996 
00997    sprintf(string, "Unexpected error #%d", code);
00998    return CM_SUCCESS;
00999 }
01000 
01001 /********************************************************************/
01032 INT cm_set_msg_print(INT system_mask, INT user_mask, int (*func) (const char *))
01033 {
01034    _message_mask_system = system_mask;
01035    _message_mask_user = user_mask;
01036    _message_print = func;
01037 
01038    return BM_SUCCESS;
01039 }
01040 
01041 /********************************************************************/
01049 INT cm_msg_log(INT message_type, const char *message)
01050 {
01051    char dir[256];
01052    char filename[256];
01053    char path[256];
01054    char str[256];
01055    FILE *f;
01056    INT status, size;
01057    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
01058 
01059    if (rpc_is_remote())
01060       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_MSG_LOG, message_type, message);
01061 
01062    if (message_type != MT_DEBUG) {
01063       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
01064 
01065       if (hDB) {
01066          status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", &hKey);
01067          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
01068             size = sizeof(dir);
01069             memset(dir, 0, size);
01070             db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
01071             if (dir[0] != 0)
01072                if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01073                   strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01074 
01075             strcpy(filename, "midas.log");
01076             size = sizeof(filename);
01077             db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Message file", filename, &size, TID_STRING,
01078                          TRUE);
01079 
01080             strcpy(path, dir);
01081             strcat(path, filename);
01082          } else {
01083             cm_get_path(dir);
01084             if (dir[0] != 0)
01085                if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01086                   strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01087 
01088             strcpy(path, dir);
01089             strcat(path, "midas.log");
01090          }
01091       } else
01092          strcpy(path, "midas.log");
01093 
01094       f = fopen(path, "a");
01095       if (f == NULL) {
01096          printf("Cannot open message log file %s\n", path);
01097       } else {
01098          strcpy(str, ss_asctime());
01099          fprintf(f, str);
01100          fprintf(f, " %s\n", message);
01101 
01102          fclose(f);
01103       }
01104    }
01105 
01106    return CM_SUCCESS;
01107 }
01108 
01109 /********************************************************************/
01118 INT cm_msg_log1(INT message_type, const char *message, const char *facility)
01119 /********************************************************************\
01120 
01121   Routine: cm_msg_log1
01122 
01123   Purpose: Write message to logging file. Called by cm_msg.
01124            Internal use only
01125 
01126   Input:
01127     INT    message_type      Message type
01128     char   *message          Message string
01129     char   *
01130 
01131   Output:
01132     none
01133 
01134   Function value:
01135     CM_SUCCESS
01136 
01137 \********************************************************************/
01138 {
01139    char dir[256];
01140    char filename[256];
01141    char path[256];
01142    char str[256];
01143    FILE *f;
01144    INT status, size;
01145    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
01146 
01147 
01148    if (rpc_is_remote())
01149       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_MSG_LOG1, message_type, message, facility);
01150 
01151    if (message_type != MT_DEBUG) {
01152       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
01153 
01154       if (hDB) {
01155          status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", &hKey);
01156          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
01157             size = sizeof(dir);
01158             memset(dir, 0, size);
01159             db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
01160             if (dir[0] != 0)
01161                if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01162                   strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01163 
01164             if (facility[0]) {
01165                strcpy(filename, facility);
01166                strcat(filename, ".log");
01167             } else {
01168                strcpy(filename, "midas.log");
01169                size = sizeof(filename);
01170                db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Message file", filename, &size, TID_STRING,
01171                             TRUE);
01172             }
01173 
01174             strcpy(path, dir);
01175             strcat(path, filename);
01176          } else {
01177             cm_get_path(dir);
01178             if (dir[0] != 0)
01179                if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01180                   strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01181 
01182             strcpy(path, dir);
01183             if (facility[0]) {
01184                strcat(path, facility);
01185                strcat(path, ".log");
01186             } else
01187                strcat(path, "midas.log");
01188          }
01189       } else {
01190          if (facility[0]) {
01191             strcpy(path, facility);
01192             strcat(path, ".log");
01193          } else
01194             strcpy(path, "midas.log");
01195       }
01196 
01197       f = fopen(path, "a");
01198       if (f == NULL) {
01199          printf("Cannot open message log file %s\n", path);
01200       } else {
01201          strcpy(str, ss_asctime());
01202          fprintf(f, str);
01203          fprintf(f, " %s\n", message);
01204          fclose(f);
01205       }
01206    }
01207 
01208    return CM_SUCCESS;
01209 }
01210 
01211 /********************************************************************/
01233 INT cm_msg(INT message_type, char *filename, INT line,
01234            const char *routine, const char *format, ...)
01235 {
01236    va_list argptr;
01237    char event[1000], str[256], local_message[256], send_message[256], *pc;
01238    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
01239    INT status;
01240    static BOOL in_routine = FALSE;
01241 
01242    /* avoid recursive calls */
01243    if (in_routine)
01244       return 0;
01245 
01246    in_routine = TRUE;
01247 
01248    /* strip path */
01249    pc = filename + strlen(filename);
01250    while (*pc != '\\' && *pc != '/' && pc != filename)
01251       pc--;
01252    if (pc != filename)
01253       pc++;
01254 
01255    /* print client name into string */
01256    if (message_type == MT_USER)
01257       sprintf(send_message, "[%s] ", routine);
01258    else {
01259       rpc_get_name(str);
01260       if (str[0])
01261          sprintf(send_message, "[%s] ", str);
01262       else
01263          send_message[0] = 0;
01264    }
01265 
01266    local_message[0] = 0;
01267 
01268    /* preceed error messages with file and line info */
01269    if (message_type == MT_ERROR) {
01270       sprintf(str, "[%s:%d:%s] ", pc, line, routine);
01271       strcat(send_message, str);
01272       strcat(local_message, str);
01273    }
01274 
01275    /* print argument list into message */
01276    va_start(argptr, format);
01277    vsprintf(str, (char *) format, argptr);
01278    va_end(argptr);
01279    strcat(send_message, str);
01280    strcat(local_message, str);
01281 
01282    /* call user function if set via cm_set_msg_print */
01283    if (_message_print != NULL && (message_type & _message_mask_user) != 0)
01284       _message_print(local_message);
01285 
01286    /* return if system mask is not set */
01287    if ((message_type & _message_mask_system) == 0) {
01288       in_routine = FALSE;
01289       return CM_SUCCESS;
01290    }
01291 
01292    /* copy message to event */
01293    pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) event;
01294    strcpy(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), send_message);
01295 
01296    /* send event if not of type MLOG */
01297    if (message_type != MT_LOG) {
01298       /* if no message buffer already opened, do so now */
01299       if (_msg_buffer == 0) {
01300          status = bm_open_buffer(MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE, &_msg_buffer);
01301          if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
01302             in_routine = FALSE;
01303             return status;
01304          }
01305       }
01306 
01307       /* setup the event header and send the message */
01308       bm_compose_event(pevent, EVENTID_MESSAGE, (WORD) message_type,
01309                        strlen(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) + 1, 0);
01310       bm_send_event(_msg_buffer, event, pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
01311    }
01312 
01313    /* log message */
01314    cm_msg_log(message_type, send_message);
01315 
01316    in_routine = FALSE;
01317 
01318    return CM_SUCCESS;
01319 }
01320 
01321 /********************************************************************/
01346 INT cm_msg1(INT message_type, char *filename, INT line,
01347             const char *facility, const char *routine, const char *format, ...)
01348 {
01349    va_list argptr;
01350    char event[1000], str[256], local_message[256], send_message[256], *pc;
01351    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
01352    INT status;
01353    static BOOL in_routine = FALSE;
01354 
01355    /* avoid recursive calles */
01356    if (in_routine)
01357       return 0;
01358 
01359    in_routine = TRUE;
01360 
01361    /* strip path */
01362    pc = filename + strlen(filename);
01363    while (*pc != '\\' && *pc != '/' && pc != filename)
01364       pc--;
01365    if (pc != filename)
01366       pc++;
01367 
01368    /* print client name into string */
01369    if (message_type == MT_USER)
01370       sprintf(send_message, "[%s] ", routine);
01371    else {
01372       rpc_get_name(str);
01373       if (str[0])
01374          sprintf(send_message, "[%s] ", str);
01375       else
01376          send_message[0] = 0;
01377    }
01378 
01379    local_message[0] = 0;
01380 
01381    /* preceed error messages with file and line info */
01382    if (message_type == MT_ERROR) {
01383       sprintf(str, "[%s:%d:%s] ", pc, line, routine);
01384       strcat(send_message, str);
01385       strcat(local_message, str);
01386    }
01387 
01388    /* print argument list into message */
01389    va_start(argptr, format);
01390    vsprintf(str, (char *) format, argptr);
01391    va_end(argptr);
01392 
01393    if (facility)
01394       sprintf(local_message + strlen(local_message), "{%s} ", facility);
01395 
01396    strcat(send_message, str);
01397    strcat(local_message, str);
01398 
01399    /* call user function if set via cm_set_msg_print */
01400    if (_message_print != NULL && (message_type & _message_mask_user) != 0)
01401       _message_print(local_message);
01402 
01403    /* return if system mask is not set */
01404    if ((message_type & _message_mask_system) == 0) {
01405       in_routine = FALSE;
01406       return CM_SUCCESS;
01407    }
01408 
01409    /* copy message to event */
01410    pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) event;
01411    strcpy(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), send_message);
01412 
01413    /* send event if not of type MLOG */
01414    if (message_type != MT_LOG) {
01415       /* if no message buffer already opened, do so now */
01416       if (_msg_buffer == 0) {
01417          status = bm_open_buffer(MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE, &_msg_buffer);
01418          if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
01419             in_routine = FALSE;
01420             return status;
01421          }
01422       }
01423 
01424       /* setup the event header and send the message */
01425       bm_compose_event(pevent, EVENTID_MESSAGE, (WORD) message_type,
01426                        strlen(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) + 1, 0);
01427       bm_send_event(_msg_buffer, event, pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
01428    }
01429 
01430    /* log message */
01431    cm_msg_log1(message_type, send_message, facility);
01432 
01433    in_routine = FALSE;
01434 
01435    return CM_SUCCESS;
01436 }
01437 
01438 /********************************************************************/
01477 INT cm_msg_register(void (*func) (HNDLE, HNDLE, EVENT_HEADER *, void *))
01478 {
01479    INT status, id;
01480 
01481    /* if no message buffer already opened, do so now */
01482    if (_msg_buffer == 0) {
01483       status = bm_open_buffer(MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE, &_msg_buffer);
01484       if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED)
01485          return status;
01486    }
01487 
01488    _msg_dispatch = func;
01489 
01490    status = bm_request_event(_msg_buffer, EVENTID_ALL, TRIGGER_ALL, GET_SOME, &id, func);
01491 
01492    return status;
01493 }
01494 
01495 /********************************************************************/
01507 INT cm_msg_retrieve(INT n_message, char *message, INT * buf_size)
01508 {
01509    char dir[256];
01510    char filename[256];
01511    char path[256], *p;
01512    FILE *f;
01513    INT status, size, offset, i;
01514    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
01515 
01516 
01517    if (rpc_is_remote())
01518       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_MSG_RETRIEVE, message, buf_size);
01519 
01520    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
01521 
01522    if (hDB) {
01523       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", &hKey);
01524       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
01525          size = sizeof(dir);
01526          memset(dir, 0, size);
01527          db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
01528          if (dir[0] != 0)
01529             if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01530                strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01531 
01532          strcpy(filename, "midas.log");
01533          size = sizeof(filename);
01534          db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Message file", filename, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
01535 
01536          strcpy(path, dir);
01537          strcat(path, filename);
01538       } else {
01539          cm_get_path(dir);
01540          if (dir[0] != 0)
01541             if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01542                strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01543 
01544          strcpy(path, dir);
01545          strcat(path, "midas.log");
01546       }
01547    } else
01548       strcpy(path, "midas.log");
01549 
01550    f = fopen(path, "rb");
01551    if (f == NULL) {
01552       sprintf(message, "Cannot open message log file %s\n", path);
01553       *buf_size = strlen(message);
01554       return CM_DB_ERROR;
01555    } else {
01556       /* position buf_size bytes before the EOF */
01557       fseek(f, -(*buf_size - 1), SEEK_END);
01558       offset = ftell(f);
01559       if (offset != 0) {
01560          /* go to end of line */
01561          fgets(message, *buf_size - 1, f);
01562          offset = ftell(f) - offset;
01563          *buf_size -= offset;
01564       }
01565 
01566       memset(message, 0, *buf_size);
01567       fread(message, 1, *buf_size - 1, f);
01568       message[*buf_size - 1] = 0;
01569       fclose(f);
01570 
01571       p = message + (*buf_size - 2);
01572 
01573       /* goto end of buffer */
01574       while (p != message && *p == 0)
01575          p--;
01576 
01577       /* strip line break */
01578       while (p != message && (*p == '\n' || *p == '\r'))
01579          *(p--) = 0;
01580 
01581       /* trim buffer so that last n_messages remain */
01582       for (i = 0; i < n_message; i++) {
01583          while (p != message && *p != '\n')
01584             p--;
01585 
01586          while (p != message && (*p == '\n' || *p == '\r'))
01587             p--;
01588       }
01589       if (p != message) {
01590          p++;
01591          while (*p == '\n' || *p == '\r')
01592             p++;
01593       }
01594 
01595       *buf_size = (*buf_size - 1) - ((PTYPE) p - (PTYPE) message);
01596 
01597       memmove(message, p, *buf_size);
01598       message[*buf_size] = 0;
01599    }
01600 
01601    return CM_SUCCESS;
01602 }
01603  /* end of msgfunctionc */
01606 
01612 /********************************************************************/
01618 INT cm_synchronize(DWORD * seconds)
01619 {
01620    INT sec, status;
01621 
01622    /* if connected to server, get time from there */
01623    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
01624       status = rpc_call(RPC_CM_SYNCHRONIZE, &sec);
01625 
01626       /* set local time */
01627       if (status == CM_SUCCESS)
01628          ss_settime(sec);
01629    }
01630 
01631    /* return time to caller */
01632    if (seconds != NULL) {
01633       *seconds = ss_time();
01634    }
01635 
01636    return CM_SUCCESS;
01637 }
01638 
01639 /********************************************************************/
01646 INT cm_asctime(char *str, INT buf_size)
01647 {
01648    /* if connected to server, get time from there */
01649    if (rpc_is_remote())
01650       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_ASCTIME, str, buf_size);
01651 
01652    /* return local time */
01653    strcpy(str, ss_asctime());
01654 
01655    return CM_SUCCESS;
01656 }
01657 
01658 /********************************************************************/
01664 INT cm_time(DWORD * time)
01665 {
01666    /* if connected to server, get time from there */
01667    if (rpc_is_remote())
01668       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_TIME, time);
01669 
01670    /* return local time */
01671    *time = ss_time();
01672 
01673    return CM_SUCCESS;
01674 }
01675  /* end of cmfunctionc */
01678 
01679 /********************************************************************\
01680 *                                                                    *
01681 *           cm_xxx  -  Common Functions to buffer & database         *
01682 *                                                                    *
01683 \********************************************************************/
01684 
01685 /* Globals */
01686 
01687 static HNDLE _hKeyClient = 0;   /* key handle for client in ODB */
01688 static HNDLE _hDB = 0;          /* Database handle */
01689 static char _client_name[NAME_LENGTH];
01690 static char _path_name[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
01691 static INT _call_watchdog = TRUE;
01692 static INT _watchdog_timeout = DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT;
01693 INT _mutex_alarm, _mutex_elog;
01694 
01704 char *cm_get_version()
01705 {
01706    return MIDAS_VERSION;
01707 }
01708 
01709 /********************************************************************/
01718 INT cm_set_path(char *path)
01719 {
01720    strcpy(_path_name, path);
01721 
01722    /* check for trailing directory seperator */
01723    if (strlen(_path_name) > 0 && _path_name[strlen(_path_name) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01724       strcat(_path_name, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01725 
01726    return CM_SUCCESS;
01727 }
01728 
01729 /********************************************************************/
01735 INT cm_get_path(char *path)
01736 {
01737    strcpy(path, _path_name);
01738 
01739    return CM_SUCCESS;
01740 }
01741  /* end of cmfunctionc */
01744 
01751 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
01752 
01753 typedef struct {
01754    char name[NAME_LENGTH];
01755    char directory[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
01756    char user[NAME_LENGTH];
01757 } experiment_table;
01758 
01759 static experiment_table exptab[MAX_EXPERIMENT];
01760 
01762 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
01763 
01771 INT cm_scan_experiments(void)
01772 {
01773    INT i;
01774    FILE *f;
01775    char str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH], alt_str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH], *pdir;
01776 
01777    for (i = 0; i < MAX_EXPERIMENT; i++)
01778       exptab[i].name[0] = 0;
01779 
01780    /* MIDAS_DIR overrides exptab */
01781    if (getenv("MIDAS_DIR")) {
01782       strlcpy(str, getenv("MIDAS_DIR"), sizeof(str));
01783 
01784       strcpy(exptab[0].name, "Default");
01785       strlcpy(exptab[0].directory, getenv("MIDAS_DIR"), sizeof(exptab[0].directory));
01786       exptab[0].user[0] = 0;
01787 
01788       return CM_SUCCESS;
01789    }
01790 
01791    /* default directory for different OSes */
01792 #if defined (OS_WINNT)
01793    if (getenv("SystemRoot"))
01794       strlcpy(str, getenv("SystemRoot"), sizeof(str));
01795    else if (getenv("windir"))
01796       strlcpy(str, getenv("windir"), sizeof(str));
01797    else
01798       strcpy(str, "");
01799 
01800    strcpy(alt_str, str);
01801    strcat(str, "\\system32\\exptab");
01802    strcat(alt_str, "\\system\\exptab");
01803 #elif defined (OS_UNIX)
01804    strcpy(str, "/etc/exptab");
01805    strcpy(alt_str, "/exptab");
01806 #else
01807    strcpy(str, "exptab");
01808    strcpy(alt_str, "exptab");
01809 #endif
01810 
01811    /* MIDAS_EXPTAB overrides default directory */
01812    if (getenv("MIDAS_EXPTAB")) {
01813       strlcpy(str, getenv("MIDAS_EXPTAB"), sizeof(str));
01814       strlcpy(alt_str, getenv("MIDAS_EXPTAB"), sizeof(alt_str));
01815    }
01816 
01817    /* read list of available experiments */
01818    f = fopen(str, "r");
01819    if (f == NULL) {
01820       f = fopen(alt_str, "r");
01821       if (f == NULL)
01822          return CM_UNDEF_ENVIRON;
01823    }
01824 
01825    i = 0;
01826    if (f != NULL) {
01827       do {
01828          str[0] = 0;
01829          if (fgets(str, 100, f) == NULL)
01830             break;
01831          if (str[0] && str[0] != '#') {
01832             sscanf(str, "%s %s %s", exptab[i].name, exptab[i].directory, exptab[i].user);
01833 
01834             /* check for trailing directory separator */
01835             pdir = exptab[i].directory;
01836             if (pdir[strlen(pdir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01837                strcat(pdir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01838 
01839             i++;
01840          }
01841       } while (!feof(f));
01842       fclose(f);
01843    }
01844 
01845    /*
01846       for (j=0 ; j<i ; j++)
01847       {
01848       sprintf(str, "Scanned experiment %s", exptab[j].name);
01849       cm_msg(MINFO, str);
01850       }
01851     */
01852 
01853    return CM_SUCCESS;
01854 }
01855 
01856 /********************************************************************/
01863 INT cm_delete_client_info(HNDLE hDB, INT pid)
01864 {
01865 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01866 
01867    /* only do it if local */
01868    if (!rpc_is_remote()) {
01869       INT status;
01870       HNDLE hKey;
01871       char str[256];
01872 
01873       if (!pid)
01874          pid = ss_gettid();
01875 
01876       /* don't delete info from a closed database */
01877       if (_database_entries == 0)
01878          return CM_SUCCESS;
01879 
01880       /* make operation atomic by locking database */
01881       db_lock_database(hDB);
01882 
01883       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d", pid);
01884       status = db_find_key1(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
01885       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
01886          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01887          return status;
01888       }
01889 
01890       /* unlock client entry and delete it without locking DB */
01891       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, 2);
01892       db_delete_key1(hDB, hKey, 1, TRUE);
01893 
01894       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01895 
01896       /* touch notify key to inform others */
01897       status = 0;
01898       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/System/Client Notify", &status, sizeof(status), 1, TID_INT);
01899    }
01900 #endif                          /*LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01901 
01902    return CM_SUCCESS;
01903 }
01904 
01905 /********************************************************************/
01914 INT cm_check_client(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyClient)
01915 {
01916 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01917 
01918    KEY key;
01919    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01920    DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01921    INT i, client_pid, status;
01922    char name[NAME_LENGTH];
01923 
01924    db_get_key(hDB, hKeyClient, &key);
01925    client_pid = atoi(key.name);
01926 
01927    i = sizeof(name);
01928    db_get_value(hDB, hKeyClient, "Name", name, &i, TID_STRING, TRUE);
01929 
01930    db_lock_database(hDB);
01931    if (_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01932       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01933       pclient = pheader->client;
01934 
01935       /* loop through clients */
01936       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pclient++)
01937          if (pclient->tid == client_pid)
01938             break;
01939 
01940       if (i == pheader->max_client_index) {
01941          /* client not found : delete ODB stucture */
01942          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01943 
01944          status = cm_delete_client_info(hDB, client_pid);
01945          if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
01946             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_check_client", "cannot delete client info");
01947          else
01948             cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_check_clinet",
01949                    "Deleted /System/Clients/%d entry for client %s\n", client_pid, name);
01950 
01951          return CM_NO_CLIENT;
01952       }
01953    }
01954 
01955    db_unlock_database(hDB);
01956 
01957 #endif                          /*LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01958 
01959    return CM_SUCCESS;
01960 }
01961 
01962 /********************************************************************/
01976 INT cm_set_client_info(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE * hKeyClient, char *host_name,
01977                        char *client_name, INT hw_type, char *password,
01978                        DWORD watchdog_timeout)
01979 {
01980    if (rpc_is_remote())
01981       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_SET_CLIENT_INFO, hDB, hKeyClient,
01982                       host_name, client_name, hw_type, password, watchdog_timeout);
01983 
01984 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01985    {
01986       INT status, pid, data, i, index, size;
01987       HNDLE hKey, hSubkey;
01988       char str[256], name[NAME_LENGTH], orig_name[NAME_LENGTH], pwd[NAME_LENGTH];
01989       BOOL call_watchdog, allow;
01990       PROGRAM_INFO_STR(program_info_str);
01991 
01992       /* check security if password is presend */
01993       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Security/Password", &hKey);
01994       if (hKey) {
01995          /* get password */
01996          size = sizeof(pwd);
01997          db_get_data(hDB, hKey, pwd, &size, TID_STRING);
01998 
01999          /* first check allowed hosts list */
02000          allow = FALSE;
02001          db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Security/Allowed hosts", &hKey);
02002          if (hKey && db_find_key(hDB, hKey, host_name, &hKey) == DB_SUCCESS)
02003             allow = TRUE;
02004 
02005          /* check allowed programs list */
02006          db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Security/Allowed programs", &hKey);
02007          if (hKey && db_find_key(hDB, hKey, client_name, &hKey) == DB_SUCCESS)
02008             allow = TRUE;
02009 
02010          /* now check password */
02011          if (!allow &&
02012              strcmp(password, pwd) != 0 && strcmp(password, "mid7qBxsNMHux") != 0) {
02013             if (password[0])
02014                cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_set_client_info", "Wrong password for host %s",
02015                       host_name);
02016             db_close_all_databases();
02017             bm_close_all_buffers();
02018             _msg_buffer = 0;
02019             return CM_WRONG_PASSWORD;
02020          }
02021       }
02022 
02023       /* make following operation atomic by locking database */
02024       db_lock_database(hDB);
02025 
02026       /* check if entry with this pid exists already */
02027       pid = ss_gettid();
02028 
02029       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d", pid);
02030       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
02031       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
02032          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, TRUE);
02033          db_delete_key(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
02034       }
02035 
02036       if (strlen(client_name) >= NAME_LENGTH)
02037          client_name[NAME_LENGTH] = 0;
02038 
02039       strcpy(name, client_name);
02040       strcpy(orig_name, client_name);
02041 
02042       /* check if client name already exists */
02043       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hKey);
02044 
02045       for (index = 1; status != DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS; index++) {
02046          for (i = 0;; i++) {
02047             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
02048             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02049                break;
02050 
02051             if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
02052                size = sizeof(str);
02053                status = db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
02054             }
02055 
02056             /* check if client is living */
02057             if (cm_check_client(hDB, hSubkey) == CM_NO_CLIENT)
02058                continue;
02059 
02060             if (equal_ustring(str, name)) {
02061                sprintf(name, "%s%d", client_name, index);
02062                break;
02063             }
02064          }
02065       }
02066 
02067       /* set name */
02068       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d/Name", pid);
02069       status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, str, name, NAME_LENGTH, 1, TID_STRING);
02070       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
02071          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02072          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_set_client_info", "cannot set client name");
02073          return status;
02074       }
02075 
02076       /* copy new client name */
02077       strcpy(client_name, name);
02078       db_set_client_name(hDB, client_name);
02079 
02080       /* set also as rpc name */
02081       rpc_set_name(client_name);
02082 
02083       /* use /system/clients/PID as root */
02084       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d", pid);
02085       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
02086 
02087       /* set host name */
02088       status =
02089           db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Host", host_name, HOST_NAME_LENGTH, 1, TID_STRING);
02090       if (status != DB_SUCCESS){
02091          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02092          return status;
02093       }
02094 
02095       /* set computer id */
02096       status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Hardware type", &hw_type,
02097                             sizeof(hw_type), 1, TID_INT);
02098       if (status != DB_SUCCESS){
02099          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02100          return status;
02101       }
02102 
02103       /* set server port */
02104       data = 0;
02105       status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Server Port", &data, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
02106       if (status != DB_SUCCESS){
02107          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02108          return status;
02109       }
02110 
02111       /* lock client entry */
02112       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
02113 
02114       /* get (set) default watchdog timeout */
02115       size = sizeof(watchdog_timeout);
02116       sprintf(str, "/Programs/%s/Watchdog Timeout", orig_name);
02117       db_get_value(hDB, 0, str, &watchdog_timeout, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
02118 
02119       /* define /programs entry */
02120       sprintf(str, "/Programs/%s", orig_name);
02121       db_create_record(hDB, 0, str, strcomb(program_info_str));
02122 
02123       /* save handle for ODB and client */
02124       rpc_set_server_option(RPC_ODB_HANDLE, hDB);
02125       rpc_set_server_option(RPC_CLIENT_HANDLE, hKey);
02126 
02127       /* save watchdog timeout */
02128       cm_get_watchdog_params(&call_watchdog, NULL);
02129       cm_set_watchdog_params(call_watchdog, watchdog_timeout);
02130       if (call_watchdog)
02131          ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
02132 
02133       /* end of atomic operations */
02134       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02135 
02136       /* touch notify key to inform others */
02137       data = 0;
02138       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/System/Client Notify", &data, sizeof(data), 1, TID_INT);
02139 
02140       *hKeyClient = hKey;
02141    }
02142 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02143 
02144    return CM_SUCCESS;
02145 }
02146 
02147 /********************************************************************/
02153 INT cm_get_client_info(char *client_name)
02154 {
02155    INT status, length;
02156    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
02157 
02158    /* get root key of client */
02159    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
02160    if (!hDB) {
02161       client_name[0] = 0;
02162       return CM_UNDEF_EXP;
02163    }
02164 
02165    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, "Name", &hKey);
02166    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02167       return status;
02168 
02169    length = NAME_LENGTH;
02170    status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, client_name, &length, TID_STRING);
02171    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02172       return status;
02173 
02174    return CM_SUCCESS;
02175 }
02176 
02177 /********************************************************************/
02229 INT cm_get_environment(char *host_name, int host_name_size, char *exp_name,
02230                        int exp_name_size)
02231 {
02232    host_name[0] = exp_name[0] = 0;
02233 
02234    if (getenv("MIDAS_SERVER_HOST"))
02235       strlcpy(host_name, getenv("MIDAS_SERVER_HOST"), host_name_size);
02236 
02237    if (getenv("MIDAS_EXPT_NAME"))
02238       strlcpy(exp_name, getenv("MIDAS_EXPT_NAME"), exp_name_size);
02239 
02240    return CM_SUCCESS;
02241 }
02242 
02243 
02245 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02246 
02247 /********************************************************************/
02248 void cm_check_connect(void)
02249 {
02250    if (_hKeyClient)
02251       cm_msg(MERROR, "", "cm_disconnect_experiment not called at end of program");
02252 }
02253 
02255 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
02256 
02257 /********************************************************************/
02327 INT cm_connect_experiment(char *host_name, char *exp_name,
02328                           char *client_name, void (*func) (char *))
02329 {
02330    INT status;
02331    char str[256];
02332 
02333    status = cm_connect_experiment1(host_name, exp_name, client_name,
02334                                    func, DEFAULT_ODB_SIZE, DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT);
02335    if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
02336       cm_get_error(status, str);
02337       puts(str);
02338    }
02339 
02340    return status;
02341 }
02342 
02343 /********************************************************************/
02349 INT cm_connect_experiment1(char *host_name, char *exp_name,
02350                            char *client_name, void (*func) (char *),
02351                            INT odb_size, DWORD watchdog_timeout)
02352 {
02353    INT status, i, mutex_elog, mutex_alarm, size;
02354    char local_host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
02355    char client_name1[NAME_LENGTH];
02356    char password[NAME_LENGTH], str[256], exp_name1[NAME_LENGTH];
02357    HNDLE hDB, hKeyClient;
02358    BOOL call_watchdog;
02359    RUNINFO_STR(runinfo_str);
02360 
02361    if (_hKeyClient)
02362       cm_disconnect_experiment();
02363 
02364    rpc_set_name(client_name);
02365 
02366    /* check for local host */
02367    if (equal_ustring(host_name, "local"))
02368       host_name[0] = 0;
02369 
02370 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02371    {
02372       WSADATA WSAData;
02373 
02374       /* Start windows sockets */
02375       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
02376          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02377    }
02378 #endif
02379 
02380    /* search for experiment name in exptab */
02381    if (exp_name == NULL)
02382       exp_name = "";
02383 
02384    strcpy(exp_name1, exp_name);
02385    if (exp_name1[0] == 0) {
02386       status = cm_select_experiment(host_name, exp_name1);
02387       if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02388          return status;
02389    }
02390 
02391    /* connect to MIDAS server */
02392    if (host_name[0]) {
02393       status = rpc_server_connect(host_name, exp_name1);
02394       if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
02395          return status;
02396 
02397       /* register MIDAS library functions */
02398       status = rpc_register_functions(rpc_get_internal_list(1), NULL);
02399       if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
02400          return status;
02401    } else {
02402       /* lookup path for *SHM files and save it */
02403       status = cm_scan_experiments();
02404       if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02405          return status;
02406 
02407       for (i = 0; i < MAX_EXPERIMENT && exptab[i].name[0]; i++)
02408          if (equal_ustring(exp_name1, exptab[i].name))
02409             break;
02410 
02411       /* return if experiment not defined */
02412       if (i == MAX_EXPERIMENT || exptab[i].name[0] == 0) {
02413          /* message should be displayed by application
02414             sprintf(str, "Experiment %s not defined in exptab\r", exp_name1);
02415             cm_msg(MERROR, str);
02416           */
02417          return CM_UNDEF_EXP;
02418       }
02419 
02420       cm_set_path(exptab[i].directory);
02421 
02422       /* create alarm and elog mutexes */
02423       status = ss_mutex_create("ALARM", &mutex_alarm);
02424       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
02425          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment", "Cannot create alarm mutex");
02426          return status;
02427       }
02428       status = ss_mutex_create("ELOG", &mutex_elog);
02429       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
02430          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment", "Cannot create elog mutex");
02431          return status;
02432       }
02433       cm_set_experiment_mutex(mutex_alarm, mutex_elog);
02434    }
02435 
02436    /* open ODB */
02437    if (odb_size == 0)
02438       odb_size = DEFAULT_ODB_SIZE;
02439 
02440    status = db_open_database("ODB", odb_size, &hDB, client_name);
02441    if (status != DB_SUCCESS && status != DB_CREATED) {
02442       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment1", "cannot open database");
02443       return status;
02444    }
02445 
02446    /* now setup client info */
02447    gethostname(local_host_name, sizeof(local_host_name));
02448 
02449    /* check watchdog timeout */
02450    if (watchdog_timeout == 0)
02451       watchdog_timeout = DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT;
02452 
02453    strcpy(client_name1, client_name);
02454    password[0] = 0;
02455    status = cm_set_client_info(hDB, &hKeyClient, local_host_name,
02456                                client_name1, rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE),
02457                                password, watchdog_timeout);
02458 
02459    if (status == CM_WRONG_PASSWORD) {
02460       if (func == NULL)
02461          strcpy(str, ss_getpass("Password: "));
02462       else
02463          func(str);
02464 
02465       /* re-open database */
02466       status = db_open_database("ODB", odb_size, &hDB, client_name);
02467       if (status != DB_SUCCESS && status != DB_CREATED) {
02468          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment1", "cannot open database");
02469          return status;
02470       }
02471 
02472       strcpy(password, ss_crypt(str, "mi"));
02473       status = cm_set_client_info(hDB, &hKeyClient, local_host_name,
02474                                   client_name1, rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE),
02475                                   password, watchdog_timeout);
02476       if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
02477          /* disconnect */
02478          if (rpc_is_remote())
02479             rpc_server_disconnect();
02480 
02481          return status;
02482       }
02483    }
02484 
02485    cm_set_experiment_database(hDB, hKeyClient);
02486 
02487    /* set experiment name in ODB */
02488    db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Name", exp_name1, NAME_LENGTH, 1, TID_STRING);
02489 
02490    /* set data dir in ODB */
02491    cm_get_path(str);
02492    size = sizeof(str);
02493    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
02494 
02495    /* check /runinfo structure */
02496    status = db_check_record(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo", strcomb(runinfo_str), FALSE);
02497    if (status == DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH) {
02498       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment1",
02499              "Aborting on mismatching /Runinfo structure");
02500       cm_disconnect_experiment();
02501       abort();
02502    }
02503 
02504    /* register server to be able to be called by other clients */
02505    status = cm_register_server();
02506    if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02507       return status;
02508 
02509    /* set watchdog timeout */
02510    cm_get_watchdog_params(&call_watchdog, &watchdog_timeout);
02511    size = sizeof(watchdog_timeout);
02512    sprintf(str, "/Programs/%s/Watchdog Timeout", client_name);
02513    db_get_value(hDB, 0, str, &watchdog_timeout, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
02514    cm_set_watchdog_params(call_watchdog, watchdog_timeout);
02515 
02516    /* send startup notification */
02517    if (strchr(local_host_name, '.'))
02518       *strchr(local_host_name, '.') = 0;
02519 
02520    /* startup message is not displayed */
02521    _message_print = NULL;
02522 
02523    cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_connect_experiment", "Program %s on host %s started",
02524           client_name, local_host_name);
02525 
02526    /* enable system and user messages to stdout as default */
02527    cm_set_msg_print(MT_ALL, MT_ALL, puts);
02528 
02529    /* call cm_check_connect when exiting */
02530    atexit((void (*)(void)) cm_check_connect);
02531 
02532    /* register ctrl-c handler */
02533    ss_ctrlc_handler(cm_ctrlc_handler);
02534 
02535    return CM_SUCCESS;
02536 }
02537 
02538 /********************************************************************/
02546 INT cm_list_experiments(char *host_name, char exp_name[MAX_EXPERIMENT][NAME_LENGTH])
02547 {
02548    INT i, status;
02549    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
02550    INT sock;
02551    char str[MAX_EXPERIMENT * NAME_LENGTH];
02552    struct hostent *phe;
02553 
02554    if (host_name[0] == 0 || equal_ustring(host_name, "local")) {
02555       status = cm_scan_experiments();
02556       if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02557          return status;
02558 
02559       for (i = 0; i < MAX_EXPERIMENT; i++)
02560          strcpy(exp_name[i], exptab[i].name);
02561 
02562       return CM_SUCCESS;
02563    }
02564 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02565    {
02566       WSADATA WSAData;
02567 
02568       /* Start windows sockets */
02569       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
02570          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02571    }
02572 #endif
02573 
02574    /* create a new socket for connecting to remote server */
02575    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
02576    if (sock == -1) {
02577       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_list_experiments", "cannot create socket");
02578       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02579    }
02580 
02581    /* connect to remote node */
02582    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
02583    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
02584    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
02585    bind_addr.sin_port = htons((short) MIDAS_TCP_PORT);
02586 
02587 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02588    {
02589       INT host_addr;
02590 
02591       host_addr = hostGetByName(host_name);
02592       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
02593    }
02594 #else
02595    phe = gethostbyname(host_name);
02596    if (phe == NULL) {
02597       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_list_experiments", "cannot get host name");
02598       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02599    }
02600    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
02601 #endif
02602 
02603 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02604    do {
02605       status = connect(sock, (void *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
02606 
02607       /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
02608    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
02609 #else
02610    status = connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
02611 #endif
02612 
02613    if (status != 0) {
02614 /*    cm_msg(MERROR, "cannot connect"); message should be displayed by application */
02615       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02616    }
02617 
02618    /* request experiment list */
02619    send(sock, "I", 2, 0);
02620 
02621    for (i = 0; i < MAX_EXPERIMENT; i++) {
02622       exp_name[i][0] = 0;
02623       status = recv_string(sock, str, sizeof(str), 1000);
02624 
02625       if (status < 0)
02626          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02627 
02628       if (status == 0)
02629          break;
02630 
02631       strcpy(exp_name[i], str);
02632    }
02633 
02634    exp_name[i][0] = 0;
02635    closesocket(sock);
02636 
02637    return CM_SUCCESS;
02638 }
02639 
02640 /********************************************************************/
02649 INT cm_select_experiment(char *host_name, char *exp_name)
02650 {
02651    INT status, i;
02652    char expts[MAX_EXPERIMENT][NAME_LENGTH];
02653    char str[32];
02654 
02655    /* retrieve list of experiments and make selection */
02656    status = cm_list_experiments(host_name, expts);
02657    if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02658       return status;
02659 
02660    if (expts[1][0]) {
02661       if (host_name[0])
02662          printf("Available experiments on server %s:\n", host_name);
02663       else
02664          printf("Available experiments on local computer:\n");
02665 
02666       for (i = 0; expts[i][0]; i++)
02667          printf("%d : %s\n", i, expts[i]);
02668       printf("Select number: ");
02669       ss_gets(str, 32);
02670       i = atoi(str);
02671       strcpy(exp_name, expts[i]);
02672    } else
02673       strcpy(exp_name, expts[0]);
02674 
02675    return CM_SUCCESS;
02676 }
02677 
02678 /********************************************************************/
02688 INT cm_connect_client(char *client_name, HNDLE * hConn)
02689 {
02690    HNDLE hDB, hKeyRoot, hSubkey, hKey;
02691    INT status, i, length, port;
02692    char name[NAME_LENGTH], host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
02693 
02694    /* find client entry in ODB */
02695    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
02696 
02697    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hKeyRoot);
02698    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02699       return status;
02700 
02701    i = 0;
02702    do {
02703       /* search for client with specific name */
02704       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, i++, &hSubkey);
02705       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02706          return CM_NO_CLIENT;
02707 
02708       status = db_find_key(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", &hKey);
02709       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02710          return status;
02711 
02712       length = NAME_LENGTH;
02713       status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, name, &length, TID_STRING);
02714       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02715          return status;
02716 
02717       if (equal_ustring(name, client_name)) {
02718          status = db_find_key(hDB, hSubkey, "Server Port", &hKey);
02719          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02720             return status;
02721 
02722          length = sizeof(INT);
02723          status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, &port, &length, TID_INT);
02724          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02725             return status;
02726 
02727          status = db_find_key(hDB, hSubkey, "Host", &hKey);
02728          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02729             return status;
02730 
02731          length = sizeof(host_name);
02732          status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, host_name, &length, TID_STRING);
02733          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02734             return status;
02735 
02736          /* client found -> connect to its server port */
02737          return rpc_client_connect(host_name, port, client_name, hConn);
02738       }
02739 
02740 
02741    } while (TRUE);
02742 }
02743 
02744 /********************************************************************/
02754 INT cm_disconnect_client(HNDLE hConn, BOOL bShutdown)
02755 {
02756    return rpc_client_disconnect(hConn, bShutdown);
02757 }
02758 
02759 /********************************************************************/
02768 INT cm_disconnect_experiment(void)
02769 {
02770    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
02771    char local_host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH], client_name[80];
02772 
02773    /* send shutdown notification */
02774    rpc_get_name(client_name);
02775    gethostname(local_host_name, sizeof(local_host_name));
02776    if (strchr(local_host_name, '.'))
02777       *strchr(local_host_name, '.') = 0;
02778 
02779    /* disconnect message not displayed */
02780    _message_print = NULL;
02781 
02782    cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_disconnect_experiment", "Program %s on host %s stopped",
02783           client_name, local_host_name);
02784 
02785    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
02786       /* close open records */
02787       db_close_all_records();
02788 
02789       rpc_client_disconnect(-1, FALSE);
02790       rpc_server_disconnect();
02791    } else {
02792       rpc_client_disconnect(-1, FALSE);
02793 
02794 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02795       ss_alarm(0, cm_watchdog);
02796       _watchdog_last_called = 0;
02797 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02798 
02799       /* delete client info */
02800       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
02801 
02802       if (hDB)
02803          cm_delete_client_info(hDB, 0);
02804 
02805       bm_close_all_buffers();
02806       db_close_all_databases();
02807    }
02808 
02809    if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_REMOTE)
02810       rpc_server_shutdown();
02811 
02812    /* free RPC list */
02813    rpc_deregister_functions();
02814 
02815    cm_set_experiment_database(0, 0);
02816 
02817    _msg_buffer = 0;
02818 
02819    /* free memory buffers */
02820    if (_event_buffer_size > 0) {
02821       M_FREE(_event_buffer);
02822       _event_buffer_size = 0;
02823    }
02824 
02825    if (_net_recv_buffer_size > 0) {
02826       M_FREE(_net_recv_buffer);
02827       _net_recv_buffer_size = 0;
02828    }
02829 
02830    if (_net_send_buffer_size > 0) {
02831       M_FREE(_net_send_buffer);
02832       _net_send_buffer_size = 0;
02833    }
02834 
02835    if (_tcp_buffer != NULL) {
02836       M_FREE(_tcp_buffer);
02837       _tcp_buffer = NULL;
02838    }
02839 
02840    return CM_SUCCESS;
02841 }
02842 
02843 /********************************************************************/
02850 INT cm_set_experiment_database(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyClient)
02851 {
02852    _hDB = hDB;
02853    _hKeyClient = hKeyClient;
02854 
02855    return CM_SUCCESS;
02856 }
02857 
02858 
02859 
02861 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02862 
02863 /********************************************************************/
02864 INT cm_set_experiment_mutex(INT mutex_alarm, INT mutex_elog)
02865 /********************************************************************\
02866 
02867   Routine: cm_set_experiment_mutex
02868 
02869   Purpose: Set the handle to the experiment wide mutexes
02870 
02871   Input:
02872     INT    mutex_alarm      Alarm mutex
02873     INT    mutex_elog       Elog mutex
02874 
02875   Output:
02876     none
02877 
02878   Function value:
02879     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02880 
02881 \********************************************************************/
02882 {
02883    _mutex_alarm = mutex_alarm;
02884    _mutex_elog = mutex_elog;
02885 
02886    return CM_SUCCESS;
02887 }
02888 
02890 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
02891 
02892 /********************************************************************/
02913 INT cm_get_experiment_database(HNDLE * hDB, HNDLE * hKeyClient)
02914 {
02915    if (_hDB) {
02916       if (hDB != NULL)
02917          *hDB = _hDB;
02918       if (hKeyClient != NULL)
02919          *hKeyClient = _hKeyClient;
02920    } else {
02921       if (hDB != NULL)
02922          *hDB = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_ODB_HANDLE);
02923       if (hKeyClient != NULL)
02924          *hKeyClient = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CLIENT_HANDLE);
02925    }
02926 
02927    return CM_SUCCESS;
02928 }
02929 
02931 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02932 
02933 /********************************************************************/
02934 INT cm_get_experiment_mutex(INT * mutex_alarm, INT * mutex_elog)
02935 /********************************************************************\
02936 
02937   Routine: cm_get_experiment_mutex
02938 
02939   Purpose: Get the handle to the experiment wide mutexes
02940 
02941   Input:
02942     none
02943 
02944   Output:
02945     INT    mutex_alarm      Alarm mutex
02946     INT    mutex_elog       Elog mutex
02947 
02948   Function value:
02949     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02950 
02951 \********************************************************************/
02952 {
02953    if (mutex_alarm)
02954       *mutex_alarm = _mutex_alarm;
02955    if (mutex_elog)
02956       *mutex_elog = _mutex_elog;
02957 
02958    return CM_SUCCESS;
02959 }
02960 
02962 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
02963 
02964 /********************************************************************/
03000 INT cm_set_watchdog_params(BOOL call_watchdog, DWORD timeout)
03001 {
03002    INT i;
03003 
03004    /* set also local timeout to requested value (needed by cm_enable_watchdog()) */
03005    _watchdog_timeout = timeout;
03006 
03007    if (rpc_is_remote())
03008       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_SET_WATCHDOG_PARAMS, call_watchdog, timeout);
03009 
03010 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03011 
03012    if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE) {
03013       HNDLE hDB, hKey;
03014 
03015       rpc_set_server_option(RPC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT, timeout);
03016 
03017       /* write timeout value to client enty in ODB */
03018       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03019 
03020       if (hDB) {
03021          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
03022          db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Link timeout", &timeout, sizeof(timeout), 1, TID_INT);
03023          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03024       }
03025    } else {
03026       _call_watchdog = call_watchdog;
03027       _watchdog_timeout = timeout;
03028 
03029       /* set watchdog flag of all open buffers */
03030       for (i = _buffer_entries; i > 0; i--) {
03031          BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
03032          BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
03033          INT index;
03034 
03035          index = _buffer[i - 1].client_index;
03036          pheader = _buffer[i - 1].buffer_header;
03037          pclient = &pheader->client[index];
03038 
03039          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
03040              _buffer[i - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception())
03041             continue;
03042 
03043          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE &&
03044              _buffer[i - 1].index != ss_gettid())
03045             continue;
03046 
03047          if (!_buffer[i - 1].attached)
03048             continue;
03049 
03050          /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
03051          pclient->watchdog_timeout = timeout;
03052 
03053          /* show activity */
03054          pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
03055       }
03056 
03057       /* set watchdog flag of alll open databases */
03058       for (i = _database_entries; i > 0; i--) {
03059          DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03060          DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
03061          INT index;
03062 
03063          db_lock_database(i);
03064          index = _database[i - 1].client_index;
03065          pheader = _database[i - 1].database_header;
03066          pclient = &pheader->client[index];
03067 
03068          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
03069              _database[i - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception()) {
03070             db_unlock_database(i);
03071             continue;
03072          }
03073 
03074          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE &&
03075              _database[i - 1].index != ss_gettid()) {
03076             db_unlock_database(i);
03077             continue;
03078          }
03079 
03080          if (!_database[i - 1].attached) {
03081             db_unlock_database(i);
03082             continue;
03083          }
03084 
03085          /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
03086          pclient->watchdog_timeout = timeout;
03087 
03088          /* show activity */
03089          pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
03090 
03091          db_unlock_database(i);
03092       }
03093 
03094       if (call_watchdog)
03095          /* restart watchdog */
03096          ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
03097       else
03098          /* kill current timer */
03099          ss_alarm(0, cm_watchdog);
03100    }
03101 
03102 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03103 
03104    return CM_SUCCESS;
03105 }
03106 
03107 /********************************************************************/
03114 INT cm_get_watchdog_params(BOOL * call_watchdog, DWORD * timeout)
03115 {
03116    if (call_watchdog)
03117       *call_watchdog = _call_watchdog;
03118    if (timeout)
03119       *timeout = _watchdog_timeout;
03120 
03121    return CM_SUCCESS;
03122 }
03123 
03124 /********************************************************************/
03134 INT cm_get_watchdog_info(HNDLE hDB, char *client_name, DWORD * timeout, DWORD * last)
03135 {
03136    if (rpc_is_remote())
03137       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_GET_WATCHDOG_INFO, hDB, client_name, timeout, last);
03138 
03139 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03140    {
03141       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03142       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
03143       INT i;
03144 
03145       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03146          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_get_watchdog_info", "invalid database handle");
03147          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03148       }
03149 
03150       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03151          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_get_watchdog_info", "invalid database handle");
03152          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03153       }
03154 
03155       /* lock database */
03156       db_lock_database(hDB);
03157 
03158       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03159       pclient = pheader->client;
03160 
03161       /* find client */
03162       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pclient++)
03163          if (pclient->pid && equal_ustring(pclient->name, client_name)) {
03164             *timeout = pclient->watchdog_timeout;
03165             *last = ss_millitime() - pclient->last_activity;
03166             db_unlock_database(hDB);
03167             return CM_SUCCESS;
03168          }
03169 
03170       *timeout = *last = 0;
03171 
03172       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03173 
03174       return CM_NO_CLIENT;
03175    }
03176 #else                           /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03177    return CM_SUCCESS;
03178 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03179 }
03180 
03181 
03183 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
03184 
03185 /********************************************************************/
03186 INT cm_register_server(void)
03187 /********************************************************************\
03188 
03189   Routine: cm_register_server
03190 
03191   Purpose: Register a server which can be called from other clients
03192            of a specific experiment.
03193 
03194   Input:
03195     none
03196 
03197   Output:
03198     none
03199 
03200   Function value:
03201     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03202 
03203 \********************************************************************/
03204 {
03205    INT status, port;
03206    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
03207 
03208    if (!_server_registered) {
03209       port = 0;
03210       status = rpc_register_server(ST_REMOTE, NULL, &port, NULL);
03211       if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
03212          return status;
03213       _server_registered = TRUE;
03214 
03215       /* register MIDAS library functions */
03216       rpc_register_functions(rpc_get_internal_list(1), NULL);
03217 
03218       /* store port number in ODB */
03219       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03220 
03221       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, "Server Port", &hKey);
03222       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03223          return status;
03224 
03225       /* unlock database */
03226       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
03227 
03228       /* set value */
03229       status = db_set_data(hDB, hKey, &port, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03230       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03231          return status;
03232 
03233       /* lock database */
03234       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03235    }
03236 
03237    return CM_SUCCESS;
03238 }
03239 
03241 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03242 
03243 /********************************************************************/
03292 INT cm_register_transition(INT transition, INT(*func) (INT, char *), INT sequence_number)
03293 {
03294    INT status, i;
03295    HNDLE hDB, hKey, hKeyTrans;
03296    KEY key;
03297    char str[256];
03298 
03299    /* check for valid transition */
03300    if (transition != TR_START && transition != TR_STOP && 
03301        transition != TR_PAUSE && transition != TR_RESUME) {
03302          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Invalid transition request \"%d\"", transition);
03303          return CM_INVALID_TRANSITION;
03304       }
03305 
03306    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03307 
03308    rpc_register_function(RPC_RC_TRANSITION, rpc_transition_dispatch);
03309 
03310    /* find empty slot */
03311    for (i = 0; i < MAX_TRANSITIONS ; i++)
03312       if (!_trans_table[i].transition) 
03313          break;
03314 
03315    if (i == MAX_TRANSITIONS) {
03316       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_register_transition", 
03317          "To many transition registrations. Please increase MAX_TRANSITIONS and recompile");
03318       return CM_TOO_MANY_REQUESTS;
03319    }
03320 
03321    _trans_table[i].transition = transition;
03322    _trans_table[i].func = func;
03323    _trans_table[i].sequence_number = sequence_number;
03324 
03325    for (i = 0; i < 13; i++)
03326       if (trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03327          break;
03328 
03329    sprintf(str, "Transition %s", trans_name[i].name);
03330 
03331    /* unlock database */
03332    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
03333 
03334    /* set value */
03335    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, str, &hKeyTrans);
03336    if (!hKeyTrans) {
03337       status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, str, &sequence_number, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03338       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03339          return status;
03340    } else {
03341       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKeyTrans, &key);
03342       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03343          return status;
03344       status = db_set_data_index(hDB, hKeyTrans, &sequence_number, sizeof(INT), key.num_values, TID_INT);      
03345       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03346          return status;
03347    }
03348 
03349    /* re-lock database */
03350    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03351 
03352    return CM_SUCCESS;
03353 }
03354 
03355 /********************************************************************/
03362 INT cm_set_transition_sequence(INT transition, INT sequence_number)
03363 {
03364    INT status, i;
03365    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
03366    char str[256];
03367 
03368    /* check for valid transition */
03369    if (transition != TR_START && transition != TR_STOP && 
03370        transition != TR_PAUSE && transition != TR_RESUME) {
03371          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Invalid transition request \"%d\"", transition);
03372          return CM_INVALID_TRANSITION;
03373       }
03374 
03375    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03376 
03377    for (i = 0; i < 13; i++)
03378       if (trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03379          break;
03380 
03381    sprintf(str, "Transition %s", trans_name[i].name);
03382 
03383    /* unlock database */
03384    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
03385 
03386    /* set value */
03387    status =
03388        db_set_value(hDB, hKey, str, &sequence_number, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03389    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03390       return status;
03391 
03392    /* re-lock database */
03393    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03394 
03395    return CM_SUCCESS;
03396 
03397 }
03398 
03400 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
03401 
03402 static INT _requested_transition;
03403 static DWORD _deferred_transition_mask;
03404 
03406 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03407 
03408 /********************************************************************/
03421 INT cm_register_deferred_transition(INT transition, BOOL(*func) (INT, BOOL))
03422 {
03423    INT status, i, size;
03424    char tr_key_name[256];
03425    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
03426 
03427    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03428 
03429    for (i = 0; _deferred_trans_table[i].transition; i++)
03430       if (_deferred_trans_table[i].transition == transition)
03431          _deferred_trans_table[i].func = (int (*)(int, char *)) func;
03432 
03433    /* set new transition mask */
03434    _deferred_transition_mask |= transition;
03435 
03436    for (i = 0; i < 13; i++)
03437       if (trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03438          break;
03439 
03440    sprintf(tr_key_name, "Transition %s DEFERRED", trans_name[i].name);
03441 
03442    /* unlock database */
03443    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
03444 
03445    /* set value */
03446    i = 0;
03447    status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, tr_key_name, &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03448    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03449       return status;
03450 
03451    /* re-lock database */
03452    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03453 
03454    /* hot link requested transition */
03455    size = sizeof(_requested_transition);
03456    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested Transition", &_requested_transition, &size,
03457                 TID_INT, TRUE);
03458    db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested Transition", &hKey);
03459    status =
03460        db_open_record(hDB, hKey, &_requested_transition, sizeof(INT), MODE_READ, NULL,
03461                       NULL);
03462    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03463       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_register_deferred_transition",
03464              "Cannot hotlink /Runinfo/Requested Transition");
03465       return status;
03466    }
03467 
03468    return CM_SUCCESS;
03469 }
03470 
03471 /********************************************************************/
03482 INT cm_check_deferred_transition()
03483 {
03484    INT i, status;
03485    char str[256];
03486    static BOOL first;
03487 
03488    if (_requested_transition == 0)
03489       first = TRUE;
03490 
03491    if (_requested_transition & _deferred_transition_mask) {
03492       for (i = 0; _deferred_trans_table[i].transition; i++)
03493          if (_deferred_trans_table[i].transition == _requested_transition)
03494             break;
03495 
03496       if (_deferred_trans_table[i].transition == _requested_transition) {
03497          if (((BOOL(*)(INT, BOOL)) _deferred_trans_table[i].func) (_requested_transition,
03498                                                                    first)) {
03499             status =
03500                 cm_transition(_requested_transition | TR_DEFERRED, 0, str, sizeof(str),
03501                               SYNC, FALSE);
03502             if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
03503                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_check_deferred_transition",
03504                       "Cannot perform deferred transition: %s", str);
03505 
03506             /* bypass hotlink and set _requested_transition directly to zero */
03507             _requested_transition = 0;
03508 
03509             return status;
03510          }
03511          first = FALSE;
03512       }
03513    }
03514 
03515    return SUCCESS;
03516 }
03517 
03518 
03520 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
03521 
03522 /********************************************************************/
03523 
03525 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03526 
03527 typedef struct {
03528    int  sequence_number;
03529    char host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
03530    char client_name[NAME_LENGTH];
03531    int  port;
03532 } TR_CLIENT;
03533 
03534 int tr_compare(const void *arg1, const void *arg2) 
03535 {
03536    return ((TR_CLIENT *)arg1)->sequence_number - ((TR_CLIENT*)arg2)->sequence_number;
03537 }
03538 
03539 /********************************************************************/
03579 INT cm_transition(INT transition, INT run_number, char *perror, INT strsize,
03580                   INT async_flag, INT debug_flag)
03581 {
03582    INT i, j, status, index, size, sequence_number, port, state, old_timeout, n_tr_clients;
03583    HNDLE hDB, hRootKey, hSubkey, hKey, hKeylocal, hConn, hKeyTrans;
03584    DWORD seconds;
03585    char host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH], client_name[NAME_LENGTH],
03586      str[256], error[256], tr_key_name[256];
03587    KEY key;
03588    BOOL deferred;
03589    PROGRAM_INFO program_info;
03590    TR_CLIENT *tr_client;
03591 
03592    deferred = (transition & TR_DEFERRED) > 0;
03593    transition &= ~TR_DEFERRED;
03594 
03595    /* check for valid transition */
03596    if (transition != TR_START && transition != TR_STOP &&
03597       transition != TR_PAUSE && transition != TR_RESUME) {
03598          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Invalid transition request \"%d\"", transition);
03599          return CM_INVALID_TRANSITION;
03600       }
03601 
03602    /* get key of local client */
03603    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKeylocal);
03604 
03605    if (perror != NULL)
03606       strcpy(perror, "Success");
03607 
03608    /* if no run number is given, get it from DB */
03609    if (run_number == 0) {
03610       size = sizeof(run_number);
03611       status =
03612           db_get_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03613       assert(status == SUCCESS);
03614    }
03615 
03616    if (run_number <= 0) {
03617       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "aborting on attempt to use invalid run number %d",
03618              run_number);
03619       abort();
03620    }
03621 
03622    /* Set new run number in ODB */
03623    if (transition == TR_START) {
03624       if (debug_flag == 1)
03625          printf("Setting run number %d in ODB\n", run_number);
03626       if (debug_flag == 2)
03627          cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: Setting run number %d in ODB", run_number);
03628 
03629       status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Run number",
03630                             &run_number, sizeof(run_number), 1, TID_INT);
03631       assert(status == SUCCESS);
03632       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03633          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot set Runinfo/Run number in database");
03634    }
03635 
03636    if (deferred) {
03637       /* remove transition request */
03638       i = 0;
03639       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested transition", &i, sizeof(int), 1, TID_INT);
03640    } else {
03641       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hRootKey);
03642       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03643          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot find System/Clients entry in database");
03644          return status;
03645       }
03646 
03647       /* check if deferred transition already in progress */
03648       size = sizeof(INT);
03649       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested transition", &i, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03650       if (i) {
03651          if (perror)
03652             sprintf(perror, "Deferred transition already in progress");
03653 
03654          return CM_TRANSITION_IN_PROGRESS;
03655       }
03656 
03657       for (i = 0; i < 13; i++)
03658          if (trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03659             break;
03660 
03661       sprintf(tr_key_name, "Transition %s DEFERRED", trans_name[i].name);
03662 
03663       /* search database for clients with deferred transition request */
03664       for (i = 0, status = 0;; i++) {
03665          status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hSubkey);
03666          if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03667             break;
03668 
03669          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03670             size = sizeof(sequence_number);
03671             status = db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, tr_key_name,
03672                                  &sequence_number, &size, TID_INT, FALSE);
03673 
03674             /* if registered for deferred transition, set flag in ODB and return */
03675             if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03676                size = NAME_LENGTH;
03677                db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03678                db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested transition", &transition,
03679                             sizeof(int), 1, TID_INT);
03680 
03681                if (debug_flag == 1)
03682                   printf("---- Transition %s deferred by client \"%s\" ----\n", trans_name[i].name, str);
03683                if (debug_flag == 2)
03684                   cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: ---- Transition %s deferred by client \"%s\" ----", 
03685                      trans_name[i].name, str);
03686 
03687                if (perror)
03688                   sprintf(perror, "Transition deferred by client \"%s\"", str);
03689 
03690                return CM_DEFERRED_TRANSITION;
03691             }
03692          }
03693       }
03694    }
03695 
03696    /* execute programs on start */
03697    if (transition == TR_START) {
03698       str[0] = 0;
03699       size = sizeof(str);
