03700       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Programs/Execute on start run", str, &size, TID_STRING,
03701                    TRUE);
03702       if (str[0])
03703          ss_system(str);
03704 
03705       db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Programs", &hRootKey);
03706       if (hRootKey) {
03707          for (i = 0;; i++) {
03708             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hKey);
03709             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03710                break;
03711 
03712             db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
03713 
03714             /* don't check "execute on xxx" */
03715             if (key.type != TID_KEY)
03716                continue;
03717 
03718             size = sizeof(program_info);
03719             status = db_get_record(hDB, hKey, &program_info, &size, 0);
03720             if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03721                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Cannot get program info record");
03722                continue;
03723             }
03724 
03725             if (program_info.auto_start && program_info.start_command[0])
03726                ss_system(program_info.start_command);
03727          }
03728       }
03729    }
03730 
03731    /* set new start time in database */
03732    if (transition == TR_START) {
03733       /* ASCII format */
03734       cm_asctime(str, sizeof(str));
03735       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Start Time", str, 32, 1, TID_STRING);
03736 
03737       /* reset stop time */
03738       seconds = 0;
03739       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Stop Time binary",
03740                    &seconds, sizeof(seconds), 1, TID_DWORD);
03741 
03742       /* Seconds since 1.1.1970 */
03743       cm_time(&seconds);
03744       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Start Time binary",
03745                    &seconds, sizeof(seconds), 1, TID_DWORD);
03746    }
03747 
03748    /* set stop time in database */
03749    if (transition == TR_STOP) {
03750       size = sizeof(state);
03751       status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/State", &state, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03752       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03753          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot get Runinfo/State in database");
03754 
03755       if (state != STATE_STOPPED) {
03756          /* stop time binary */
03757          cm_time(&seconds);
03758          status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Stop Time binary",
03759                                &seconds, sizeof(seconds), 1, TID_DWORD);
03760          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03761             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition",
03762                    "cannot set \"Runinfo/Stop Time binary\" in database");
03763 
03764          /* stop time ascii */
03765          cm_asctime(str, sizeof(str));
03766          status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Stop Time", str, 32, 1, TID_STRING);
03767          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03768             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition",
03769                    "cannot set \"Runinfo/Stop Time\" in database");
03770       }
03771    }
03772 
03773    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hRootKey);
03774    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03775       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot find System/Clients entry in database");
03776       return status;
03777    }
03778 
03779    for (i = 0; i < 13; i++)
03780       if (trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03781          break;
03782 
03783    if (debug_flag == 1)
03784       printf("---- Transition %s started ----\n", trans_name[i].name);
03785    if (debug_flag == 2)
03786       cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: ---- Transition %s started ----", trans_name[i].name);
03787 
03788    sprintf(tr_key_name, "Transition %s", trans_name[i].name);
03789 
03790    /* search database for clients which registered for transition */
03791    n_tr_clients = 0;
03792    tr_client = NULL;
03793 
03794    for (i = 0, status = 0;; i++) {
03795       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hSubkey);
03796       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03797          break;
03798 
03799       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03800          status = db_find_key(hDB, hSubkey, tr_key_name, &hKeyTrans);
03801 
03802          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03803 
03804             db_get_key(hDB, hKeyTrans, &key);
03805 
03806             for (j=0 ; j<key.num_values ; j++) {
03807                size = sizeof(sequence_number);
03808                status = db_get_data_index(hDB, hKeyTrans, &sequence_number, &size, j, TID_INT);
03809                assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
03810 
03811                if (tr_client == NULL)
03812                   tr_client = (TR_CLIENT *) malloc(sizeof(TR_CLIENT));
03813                else
03814                   tr_client = (TR_CLIENT *) realloc(tr_client, sizeof(TR_CLIENT)*(n_tr_clients+1));
03815                assert(tr_client);
03816 
03817                tr_client[n_tr_clients].sequence_number = sequence_number;
03818 
03819                if (hSubkey == hKeylocal) {
03820                   /* remember own client */
03821                   tr_client[n_tr_clients].port = 0;
03822                } else {
03823                   /* get client info */
03824                   size = sizeof(client_name);
03825                   db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", client_name, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03826                   strcpy(tr_client[n_tr_clients].client_name, client_name);
03827 
03828                   size = sizeof(port);
03829                   db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Server Port", &port, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03830                   tr_client[n_tr_clients].port = port;
03831 
03832                   size = sizeof(host_name);
03833                   db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Host", host_name, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03834                   strcpy(tr_client[n_tr_clients].host_name, host_name);
03835                }
03836 
03837                n_tr_clients++;
03838             }
03839          }
03840       }
03841    }
03842 
03843    /* sort clients according to sequence number */
03844    if (n_tr_clients > 1)
03845       qsort(tr_client, n_tr_clients, sizeof(TR_CLIENT), tr_compare);
03846 
03847    /* contact ordered clients for transition */
03848    for (index=0 ; index<n_tr_clients; index++) {
03849       /* erase error string */
03850       error[0] = 0;
03851 
03852       if (debug_flag == 1)
03853          printf("\n==== Found client \"%s\" with sequence number %d\n", tr_client[index].client_name, 
03854             tr_client[index].sequence_number);
03855       if (debug_flag == 2)
03856          cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: ==== Found client \"%s\" with sequence number %d",
03857             tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].sequence_number);
03858 
03859       /* if own client call transition callback directly */
03860       if (tr_client[index].port == 0) {
03861          for (i = 0; _trans_table[i].transition; i++)
03862             if (_trans_table[i].transition == transition)
03863                break;
03864 
03865          /* call registerd function */
03866          if (_trans_table[i].transition == transition && _trans_table[i].func) {
03867             if (debug_flag == 1)
03868                printf("Calling local transition callback\n");
03869             if (debug_flag == 2)
03870                cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: Calling local transition callback");
03871 
03872             status = _trans_table[i].func(run_number, error);
03873 
03874             if (debug_flag == 1)
03875                printf("Local transition callback finished\n");
03876             if (debug_flag == 2)
03877                cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: Local transition callback finished");
03878          } else
03879             status = CM_SUCCESS;
03880 
03881          if (perror != NULL)
03882             memcpy(perror, error, (INT) strlen(error) + 1 < strsize ?
03883                      strlen(error) + 1 : strsize);
03884 
03885          if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
03886             free(tr_client);
03887             return status;
03888          }
03889 
03890       } else {
03891          
03892          /* contact client if transition mask set */
03893          if (debug_flag == 1)
03894             printf("Connecting to client \"%s\" on host %s...\n", 
03895                tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03896          if (debug_flag == 2)
03897             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03898                "cm_transition: Connecting to client \"%s\" on host %s...", 
03899                tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03900 
03901          /* client found -> connect to its server port */
03902          status = rpc_client_connect(tr_client[index].host_name, tr_client[index].port, 
03903                                      tr_client[index].client_name, &hConn);
03904          if (status != RPC_SUCCESS) {
03905             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot connect to client \"%s\" on host %s, port %d",
03906                      tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name, 
03907                      tr_client[index].port);
03908             continue;
03909          }
03910 
03911          if (debug_flag == 1)
03912             printf("Connection established to client \"%s\" on host %s\n", 
03913               tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03914          if (debug_flag == 2)
03915             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03916                "cm_transition: Connection established to client \"%s\" on host %s", 
03917                 tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03918 
03919          /* call RC_TRANSITION on remote client with increased timeout */
03920          old_timeout = rpc_get_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT);
03921          rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT, 120000);
03922 
03923          /* set FTPC protocol if in async mode */
03924          if (async_flag == ASYNC)
03925             rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
03926 
03927          if (debug_flag== 1)
03928             printf("Executing RPC transition client \"%s\" on host %s...\n", 
03929               tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03930          if (debug_flag == 2)
03931             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03932                "cm_transition: Executing RPC transition client \"%s\" on host %s...", 
03933                  tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03934 
03935          status = rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_RC_TRANSITION, transition,
03936             run_number, error, strsize, tr_client[index].sequence_number);
03937 
03938          /* reset timeout */
03939          rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT, old_timeout);
03940 
03941          /* reset protocol */
03942          if (async_flag == ASYNC)
03943             rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
03944 
03945          if (debug_flag == 1)
03946             printf("RPC transition finished client \"%s\" on host %s\n", 
03947               tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03948          if (debug_flag == 2)
03949             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03950                "cm_transition: RPC transition finished client \"%s\" on host %s", 
03951                  tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03952 
03953          if (perror != NULL)
03954             memcpy(perror, error, (INT) strlen(error) + 1 < strsize ?
03955                      strlen(error) + 1 : strsize);
03956 
03957          if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
03958             free(tr_client);
03959             return status;
03960          }
03961       }
03962    }
03963 
03964    if (tr_client)
03965       free(tr_client);
03966 
03967    for (i = 0; i < 13; i++)
03968       if (trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03969          break;
03970 
03971    if (debug_flag == 1)
03972       printf("\n---- Transition %s finished ----\n", trans_name[i].name);
03973    if (debug_flag == 2)
03974       cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03975          "cm_transition: ---- Transition %s finished ----", trans_name[i].name);
03976 
03977    /* set new run state in database */
03978    if (transition == TR_START || transition == TR_RESUME)
03979       state = STATE_RUNNING;
03980 
03981    if (transition == TR_PAUSE)
03982       state = STATE_PAUSED;
03983 
03984    if (transition == TR_STOP)
03985       state = STATE_STOPPED;
03986 
03987    size = sizeof(state);
03988    status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/State", &state, size, 1, TID_INT);
03989    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03990       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot set Runinfo/State in database");
03991 
03992    /* send notification message */
03993    str[0] = 0;
03994    if (transition == TR_START)
03995       sprintf(str, "Run #%d started", run_number);
03996    if (transition == TR_STOP)
03997       sprintf(str, "Run #%d stopped", run_number);
03998    if (transition == TR_PAUSE)
03999       sprintf(str, "Run #%d paused", run_number);
04000    if (transition == TR_RESUME)
04001       sprintf(str, "Run #%d resumed", run_number);
04002 
04003    if (str[0])
04004       cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition", str);
04005 
04006    /* lock/unlock ODB values if present */
04007    db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Lock when running", &hKey);
04008    if (hKey && transition == TR_START)
04009       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
04010    if (hKey && transition == TR_STOP)
04011       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, TRUE);
04012 
04013    /* flush online database */
04014    if (transition == TR_STOP)
04015       db_flush_database(hDB);
04016 
04017    /* execute/stop programs on stop */
04018    if (transition == TR_STOP) {
04019       str[0] = 0;
04020       size = sizeof(str);
04021       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Programs/Execute on stop run", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
04022       if (str[0])
04023          ss_system(str);
04024 
04025       db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Programs", &hRootKey);
04026       if (hRootKey) {
04027          for (i = 0;; i++) {
04028             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hKey);
04029             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
04030                break;
04031 
04032             db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
04033 
04034             /* don't check "execute on xxx" */
04035             if (key.type != TID_KEY)
04036                continue;
04037 
04038             size = sizeof(program_info);
04039             status = db_get_record(hDB, hKey, &program_info, &size, 0);
04040             if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
04041                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Cannot get program info record");
04042                continue;
04043             }
04044 
04045             if (program_info.auto_stop)
04046                cm_shutdown(key.name, FALSE);
04047          }
04048       }
04049    }
04050 
04051    /* send notification */
04052    if (transition == TR_START) {
04053       int sock, size;
04054       struct sockaddr_in addr;
04055       char buffer[512], str[256];
04056 
04057       sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
04058       memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(addr));
04059       addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
04060       addr.sin_port = htons((short) MIDAS_TCP_PORT);
04061       addr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(2172773399u);
04062 
04063       str[0] = 0;
04064       size = sizeof(str);
04065       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Name", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
04066       sprintf(buffer, "%s %s %d", str, cm_get_version(), run_number);
04067       sendto(sock, buffer, strlen(buffer), 0, (struct sockaddr *) &addr, sizeof(addr));
04068       closesocket(sock);
04069    }
04070 
04071    return CM_SUCCESS;
04072 }
04073 
04074 
04075 
04077 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
04078 
04079 /********************************************************************/
04080 INT cm_dispatch_ipc(char *message, int socket)
04081 /********************************************************************\
04082 
04083   Routine: cm_dispatch_ipc
04084 
04085   Purpose: Called from ss_suspend if an IPC message arrives
04086 
04087   Input:
04088     INT   msg               IPC message we got, MSG_ODB/MSG_BM
04089     INT   p1, p2            Optional parameters
04090     int   socket            Optional server socket
04091 
04092   Output:
04093     none
04094 
04095   Function value:
04096     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04097 
04098 \********************************************************************/
04099 {
04100    if (message[0] == 'O') {
04101       HNDLE hDB, hKey;
04102       sscanf(message + 2, "%d %d", &hDB, &hKey);
04103       return db_update_record(hDB, hKey, socket);
04104    }
04105 
04106    /* message == "B  " means "resume event sender" */
04107    if (message[0] == 'B' && message[2] != ' ') {
04108       char str[80];
04109 
04110       strcpy(str, message + 2);
04111       if (strchr(str, ' '))
04112          *strchr(str, ' ') = 0;
04113 
04114       if (socket)
04115          return bm_notify_client(str, socket);
04116       else
04117          return bm_push_event(str);
04118    }
04119 
04120    return CM_SUCCESS;
04121 }
04122 
04123 /********************************************************************/
04124 static BOOL _ctrlc_pressed = FALSE;
04125 
04126 void cm_ctrlc_handler(int sig)
04127 {
04128    if (_ctrlc_pressed) {
04129       printf("Received 2nd break. Hard abort.\n");
04130       exit(0);
04131    }
04132    printf("Received break. Aborting...\n");
04133    _ctrlc_pressed = TRUE;
04134 
04135    ss_ctrlc_handler(cm_ctrlc_handler);
04136 }
04137 
04138 BOOL cm_is_ctrlc_pressed()
04139 {
04140    return _ctrlc_pressed;
04141 }
04142 
04143 void cm_ack_ctrlc_pressed()
04144 {
04145    _ctrlc_pressed = FALSE;
04146 }
04147 
04148 
04150 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
04151 
04152 /********************************************************************/
04166 INT cm_yield(INT millisec)
04167 {
04168    INT status;
04169    BOOL bMore;
04170    static DWORD last_checked = 0;
04171 
04172    /* check for ctrl-c */
04173    if (_ctrlc_pressed)
04174       return RPC_SHUTDOWN;
04175 
04176    /* check for available events */
04177    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
04178       bMore = bm_poll_event(TRUE);
04179       if (bMore)
04180          status = ss_suspend(0, 0);
04181       else
04182          status = ss_suspend(millisec, 0);
04183 
04184       return status;
04185    }
04186 
04187    /* check alarms once every 10 seconds */
04188    if (!rpc_is_remote() && ss_time() - last_checked > 10) {
04189       al_check();
04190       last_checked = ss_time();
04191    }
04192 
04193    bMore = bm_check_buffers();
04194 
04195    if (bMore) {
04196       /* if events available, quickly check other IPC channels */
04197       status = ss_suspend(0, 0);
04198    } else {
04199       /* mark event buffers for ready-to-receive */
04200       bm_mark_read_waiting(TRUE);
04201 
04202       status = ss_suspend(millisec, 0);
04203 
04204       /* unmark event buffers for ready-to-receive */
04205       bm_mark_read_waiting(FALSE);
04206    }
04207 
04208    return status;
04209 }
04210 
04211 /********************************************************************/
04219 INT cm_execute(char *command, char *result, INT bufsize)
04220 {
04221    char str[256];
04222    INT n;
04223    int fh;
04224 
04225    if (rpc_is_remote())
04226       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_EXECUTE, command, result, bufsize);
04227 
04228    if (bufsize > 0) {
04229       strcpy(str, command);
04230       sprintf(str, "%s > %d.tmp", command, ss_getpid());
04231 
04232       system(str);
04233 
04234       sprintf(str, "%d.tmp", ss_getpid());
04235       fh = open(str, O_RDONLY, 0644);
04236       result[0] = 0;
04237       if (fh) {
04238          n = read(fh, result, bufsize - 1);
04239          result[MAX(0, n)] = 0;
04240          close(fh);
04241       }
04242       remove(str);
04243    } else
04244       system(command);
04245 
04246    return CM_SUCCESS;
04247 }
04248 
04249 
04250 
04252 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
04253 
04254 /********************************************************************/
04255 INT cm_register_function(INT id, INT(*func) (INT, void **))
04256 /********************************************************************\
04257 
04258   Routine: cm_register_function
04259 
04260   Purpose: Call rpc_register_function and publish the registered
04261            function under system/clients/<pid>/RPC
04262 
04263   Input:
04264     INT      id             RPC ID
04265     INT      *func          New dispatch function
04266 
04267   Output:
04268    <implicit: func gets copied to rpc_list>
04269 
04270   Function value:
04271    CM_SUCCESS               Successful completion
04272    RPC_INVALID_ID           RPC ID not found
04273 
04274 \********************************************************************/
04275 {
04276    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
04277    INT status;
04278    char str[80];
04279 
04280    status = rpc_register_function(id, func);
04281    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
04282       return status;
04283 
04284    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
04285 
04286    /* create new key for this id */
04287    status = 1;
04288    sprintf(str, "RPC/%d", id);
04289 
04290    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
04291    status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, str, &status, sizeof(BOOL), 1, TID_BOOL);
04292    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
04293 
04294    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
04295       return status;
04296 
04297    return CM_SUCCESS;
04298 }
04299 
04300 
04302 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
04303  /* end of cmfunctionc */
04306 
04312 /********************************************************************\
04313 *                                                                    *
04314 *                 bm_xxx  -  Buffer Manager Functions                *
04315 *                                                                    *
04316 \********************************************************************/
04317 
04318 /********************************************************************/
04327 INT bm_match_event(short int event_id, short int trigger_mask, EVENT_HEADER * pevent)
04328 {
04329    if ((pevent->event_id & 0xF000) == EVENTID_FRAG1 ||
04330        (pevent->event_id & 0xF000) == EVENTID_FRAG)
04331       /* fragmented event */
04332       return ((event_id == EVENTID_ALL ||
04333                event_id == (pevent->event_id & 0x0FFF)) &&
04334               (trigger_mask == TRIGGER_ALL || (trigger_mask & pevent->trigger_mask)));
04335 
04336    return ((event_id == EVENTID_ALL ||
04337             event_id == pevent->event_id) &&
04338            (trigger_mask == TRIGGER_ALL || (trigger_mask & pevent->trigger_mask)));
04339 }
04340 
04341 /********************************************************************/
04389 INT bm_open_buffer(char *buffer_name, INT buffer_size, INT * buffer_handle)
04390 {
04391    INT status;
04392 
04393    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
04394       status = rpc_call(RPC_BM_OPEN_BUFFER, buffer_name, buffer_size, buffer_handle);
04395       bm_mark_read_waiting(TRUE);
04396       return status;
04397    }
04398 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04399    {
04400       INT i, handle;
04401       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
04402       BOOL shm_created;
04403       HNDLE shm_handle;
04404       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
04405 
04406       if (buffer_size <= 0 || buffer_size > 32E6) {
04407          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_open_buffer", "invalid buffer size");
04408          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
04409       }
04410 
04411       if (!buffer_name[0]) {
04412          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_open_buffer", "cannot open buffer with zero name");
04413          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
04414       }
04415 
04416       /* allocate new space for the new buffer descriptor */
04417       if (_buffer_entries == 0) {
04418          _buffer = (BUFFER *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(BUFFER));
04419          memset(_buffer, 0, sizeof(BUFFER));
04420          if (_buffer == NULL) {
04421             *buffer_handle = 0;
04422             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
04423          }
04424 
04425          _buffer_entries = 1;
04426          i = 0;
04427       } else {
04428          /* check if buffer alreay is open */
04429          for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
04430             if (_buffer[i].attached &&
04431                 equal_ustring(_buffer[i].buffer_header->name, buffer_name)) {
04432                if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
04433                    _buffer[i].index != rpc_get_server_acception())
04434                   continue;
04435 
04436                if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE &&
04437                    _buffer[i].index != ss_gettid())
04438                   continue;
04439 
04440                *buffer_handle = i + 1;
04441                return BM_SUCCESS;
04442             }
04443 
04444          /* check for a deleted entry */
04445          for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
04446             if (!_buffer[i].attached)
04447                break;
04448 
04449          /* if not found, create new one */
04450          if (i == _buffer_entries) {
04451             _buffer = (BUFFER *) realloc(_buffer, sizeof(BUFFER) * (_buffer_entries + 1));
04452             memset(&_buffer[_buffer_entries], 0, sizeof(BUFFER));
04453 
04454             _buffer_entries++;
04455             if (_buffer == NULL) {
04456                _buffer_entries--;
04457                *buffer_handle = 0;
04458                return BM_NO_MEMORY;
04459             }
04460          }
04461 
04462       }
04463 
04464       handle = i;
04465 
04466       if (strlen(buffer_name) >= NAME_LENGTH)
04467          buffer_name[NAME_LENGTH] = 0;
04468 
04469       /* reduce buffer size is larger than maximum */
04470 #ifdef MAX_SHM_SIZE
04471       if (buffer_size + sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER) > MAX_SHM_SIZE)
04472          buffer_size = MAX_SHM_SIZE - sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER);
04473 #endif
04474 
04475       /* open shared memory region */
04476       status = ss_shm_open(buffer_name, sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER) + buffer_size,
04477                            (void **) &(_buffer[handle].buffer_header), &shm_handle);
04478 
04479       if (status == SS_NO_MEMORY || status == SS_FILE_ERROR) {
04480          *buffer_handle = 0;
04481          return BM_NO_SHM;
04482       }
04483 
04484       pheader = _buffer[handle].buffer_header;
04485 
04486       shm_created = (status == SS_CREATED);
04487 
04488       if (shm_created) {
04489          /* setup header info if buffer was created */
04490          memset(pheader, 0, sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER));
04491 
04492          strcpy(pheader->name, buffer_name);
04493          pheader->size = buffer_size;
04494       } else {
04495          /* check if buffer size is identical */
04496          if (pheader->size != buffer_size) {
04497             buffer_size = pheader->size;
04498 
04499             /* re-open shared memory with proper size */
04500 
04501             status = ss_shm_close(buffer_name, _buffer[handle].buffer_header,
04502                                   shm_handle, FALSE);
04503             if (status != BM_SUCCESS)
04504                return BM_MEMSIZE_MISMATCH;
04505 
04506             status = ss_shm_open(buffer_name, sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER) + buffer_size,
04507                                  (void **) &(_buffer[handle].buffer_header), &shm_handle);
04508 
04509             if (status == SS_NO_MEMORY || status == SS_FILE_ERROR) {
04510                *buffer_handle = 0;
04511                return BM_INVALID_NAME;
04512             }
04513 
04514             pheader = _buffer[handle].buffer_header;
04515          }
04516       }
04517 
04518       /* create mutex for the buffer */
04519       status = ss_mutex_create(buffer_name, &(_buffer[handle].mutex));
04520       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
04521          *buffer_handle = 0;
04522          return BM_NO_MUTEX;
04523       }
04524 
04525       /* first lock buffer */
04526       bm_lock_buffer(handle + 1);
04527 
04528       /*
04529          Now we have a BUFFER_HEADER, so let's setup a CLIENT
04530          structure in that buffer. The information there can also
04531          be seen by other processes.
04532        */
04533 
04534       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++)
04535          if (pheader->client[i].pid == 0)
04536             break;
04537 
04538       if (i == MAX_CLIENTS) {
04539          bm_unlock_buffer(handle + 1);
04540          *buffer_handle = 0;
04541          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_open_buffer", "maximum number of clients exceeded");
04542          return BM_NO_SLOT;
04543       }
04544 
04545       /* store slot index in _buffer structure */
04546       _buffer[handle].client_index = i;
04547 
04548       /*
04549          Save the index of the last client of that buffer so that later only
04550          the clients 0..max_client_index-1 have to be searched through.
04551        */
04552       pheader->num_clients++;
04553       if (i + 1 > pheader->max_client_index)
04554          pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
04555 
04556       /* setup buffer header and client structure */
04557       pclient = &pheader->client[i];
04558 
04559       memset(pclient, 0, sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT));
04560       /* use client name previously set by bm_set_name */
04561       cm_get_client_info(pclient->name);
04562       if (pclient->name[0] == 0)
04563          strcpy(pclient->name, "unknown");
04564       pclient->pid = ss_getpid();
04565       pclient->tid = ss_gettid();
04566       pclient->thandle = ss_getthandle();
04567 
04568       ss_suspend_get_port(&pclient->port);
04569 
04570       pclient->read_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
04571       pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
04572 
04573       cm_get_watchdog_params(NULL, &pclient->watchdog_timeout);
04574 
04575       bm_unlock_buffer(handle + 1);
04576 
04577       /* setup _buffer entry */
04578       _buffer[handle].buffer_data = _buffer[handle].buffer_header + 1;
04579       _buffer[handle].attached = TRUE;
04580       _buffer[handle].shm_handle = shm_handle;
04581       _buffer[handle].callback = FALSE;
04582 
04583       /* remember to which connection acutal buffer belongs */
04584       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE)
04585          _buffer[handle].index = rpc_get_server_acception();
04586       else
04587          _buffer[handle].index = ss_gettid();
04588 
04589       *buffer_handle = (handle + 1);
04590 
04591       /* initialize buffer counters */
04592       bm_init_buffer_counters(handle + 1);
04593 
04594       /* setup dispatcher for receive events */
04595       ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_IPC, 0, (int (*)(void)) cm_dispatch_ipc);
04596 
04597       if (shm_created)
04598          return BM_CREATED;
04599    }
04600 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04601 
04602    return BM_SUCCESS;
04603 }
04604 
04605 /********************************************************************/
04611 INT bm_close_buffer(INT buffer_handle)
04612 {
04613    if (rpc_is_remote())
04614       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_CLOSE_BUFFER, buffer_handle);
04615 
04616 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04617    {
04618       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
04619       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
04620       INT i, j, index, destroy_flag;
04621 
04622       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
04623          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_close_buffer", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
04624          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
04625       }
04626 
04627       /*
04628          Check if buffer was opened by current thread. This is necessary
04629          in the server process where one thread may not close the buffer
04630          of other threads.
04631        */
04632 
04633       index = _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].client_index;
04634       pheader = _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header;
04635 
04636       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
04637           _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception())
04638          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
04639 
04640       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE &&
04641           _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].index != ss_gettid())
04642          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
04643 
04644       if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
04645          /* don't produce error, since bm_close_all_buffers() might want to close an
04646             already closed buffer */
04647          return BM_SUCCESS;
04648       }
04649 
04650       /* delete all requests for this buffer */
04651       for (i = 0; i < _request_list_entries; i++)
04652          if (_request_list[i].buffer_handle == buffer_handle)
04653             bm_delete_request(i);
04654 
04655       /* first lock buffer */
04656       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
04657 
04658       /* mark entry in _buffer as empty */
04659       _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached = FALSE;
04660 
04661       /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
04662       memset(&(pheader->client[index]), 0, sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT));
04663 
04664       /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
04665       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; i >= 0; i--)
04666          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
04667             break;
04668       pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
04669 
04670       /* count new number of clients */
04671       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, j = 0; i >= 0; i--)
04672          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
04673             j++;
04674       pheader->num_clients = j;
04675 
04676       destroy_flag = (pheader->num_clients == 0);
04677 
04678       /* free cache */
04679       if (_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].read_cache_size > 0)
04680          M_FREE(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].read_cache);
04681       if (_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].write_cache_size > 0)
04682          M_FREE(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].write_cache);
04683 
04684       /* check if anyone is waiting and wake him up */
04685       pclient = pheader->client;
04686 
04687       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pclient++)
04688          if (pclient->pid && (pclient->write_wait || pclient->read_wait))
04689             ss_resume(pclient->port, "B  ");
04690 
04691       /* unmap shared memory, delete it if we are the last */
04692       ss_shm_close(pheader->name, _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header,
04693                    _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].shm_handle, destroy_flag);
04694 
04695       /* unlock buffer */
04696       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
04697 
04698       /* delete mutex */
04699       ss_mutex_delete(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].mutex, destroy_flag);
04700 
04701       /* update _buffer_entries */
04702       if (buffer_handle == _buffer_entries)
04703          _buffer_entries--;
04704 
04705       if (_buffer_entries > 0)
04706          _buffer = (BUFFER *) realloc(_buffer, sizeof(BUFFER) * (_buffer_entries));
04707       else {
04708          M_FREE(_buffer);
04709          _buffer = NULL;
04710       }
04711    }
04712 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04713 
04714    return BM_SUCCESS;
04715 }
04716 
04717 /********************************************************************/
04722 INT bm_close_all_buffers(void)
04723 {
04724    if (rpc_is_remote())
04725       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_CLOSE_ALL_BUFFERS);
04726 
04727 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04728    {
04729       INT i;
04730 
04731       for (i = _buffer_entries; i > 0; i--)
04732          bm_close_buffer(i);
04733    }
04734 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04735 
04736    return BM_SUCCESS;
04737 }
04738  /* end of bmfunctionc */
04741 
04747 /*-- Watchdog routines ---------------------------------------------*/
04748 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04749 
04750 /********************************************************************/
04756 void cm_watchdog(int dummy)
04757 {
04758    BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
04759    BUFFER_CLIENT *pbclient, *pbctmp;
04760    DATABASE_HEADER *pdbheader;
04761    DATABASE_CLIENT *pdbclient;
04762    KEY *pkey;
04763    DWORD actual_time, interval;
04764    INT client_pid;
04765    INT i, j, k, nc, status;
04766    BOOL bDeleted, time_changed, wrong_interval;
04767    char str[256];
04768 
04769    /* return immediately if watchdog has been disabled in meantime */
04770    if (!_call_watchdog)
04771       return;
04772 
04773    /* tell system services that we are in async mode ... */
04774    ss_set_async_flag(TRUE);
04775 
04776    /* Calculate the time since last watchdog call. Kill clients if they
04777       are inactive for more than the timeout they specified */
04778    actual_time = ss_millitime();
04779    if (_watchdog_last_called == 0)
04780       _watchdog_last_called = actual_time - WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
04781    interval = actual_time - _watchdog_last_called;
04782 
04783    /* check if system time has been changed more than 10 min */
04784    time_changed = interval < 0 || interval > 600000;
04785    wrong_interval = interval < 0.8 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL
04786        || interval > 1.2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
04787 
04788    if (time_changed)
04789       cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_watchdog",
04790              "System time has been changed! last:%dms  now:%dms  delta:%dms",
04791              _watchdog_last_called, actual_time, interval);
04792 
04793    /* check buffers */
04794    for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
04795       if (_buffer[i].attached) {
04796          /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
04797          pheader = _buffer[i].buffer_header;
04798          pbclient = pheader->client;
04799          pbclient[_buffer[i].client_index].last_activity = actual_time;
04800 
04801          /* don't check other clients if interval is stange */
04802          if (wrong_interval)
04803             continue;
04804 
04805          /* now check other clients */
04806          for (j = 0; j < pheader->max_client_index; j++, pbclient++)
04807             /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
04808             if (pbclient->pid && pbclient->watchdog_timeout > 0 &&
04809                 actual_time - pbclient->last_activity > pbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04810                bm_lock_buffer(i + 1);
04811                str[0] = 0;
04812 
04813                /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
04814                actual_time = ss_millitime();
04815                if (pbclient->pid && pbclient->watchdog_timeout > 0 &&
04816                    actual_time > pbclient->last_activity &&
04817                    actual_time - pbclient->last_activity > pbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04818                   sprintf(str, "Client %s on %s removed (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
04819                           pbclient->name, pheader->name,
04820                           (actual_time - pbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
04821                           pbclient->watchdog_timeout / 1000.0);
04822 
04823                   /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
04824                   memset(&(pheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT));
04825 
04826                   /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
04827                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
04828                      if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04829                         break;
04830                   pheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
04831 
04832                   /* count new number of clients */
04833                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
04834                      if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04835                         nc++;
04836                   pheader->num_clients = nc;
04837 
04838                   /* check if anyone is wating and wake him up */
04839                   pbctmp = pheader->client;
04840 
04841                   for (k = 0; k < pheader->max_client_index; k++, pbctmp++)
04842                      if (pbctmp->pid && (pbctmp->write_wait || pbctmp->read_wait))
04843                         ss_resume(pbctmp->port, "B  ");
04844 
04845                }
04846 
04847                bm_unlock_buffer(i + 1);
04848 
04849                /* display info message after unlocking buffer */
04850                if (str[0])
04851                   cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_watchdog", str);
04852             }
04853       }
04854 
04855    /* check online databases */
04856    for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
04857       if (_database[i].attached) {
04858          /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
04859          pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
04860          pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
04861          pdbclient[_database[i].client_index].last_activity = actual_time;
04862 
04863          /* don't check other clients if interval is stange */
04864          if (wrong_interval)
04865             continue;
04866 
04867          /* now check other clients */
04868          for (j = 0; j < pdbheader->max_client_index; j++, pdbclient++)
04869             /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
04870             if (pdbclient->pid && pdbclient->watchdog_timeout > 0 &&
04871                 actual_time - pdbclient->last_activity > pdbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04872                client_pid = pdbclient->tid;
04873                bDeleted = FALSE;
04874                db_lock_database(i + 1);
04875                str[0] = 0;
04876 
04877                /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
04878                actual_time = ss_millitime();
04879                if (pdbclient->pid && pdbclient->watchdog_timeout &&
04880                    actual_time > pdbclient->last_activity &&
04881                    actual_time - pdbclient->last_activity > pdbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04882                   sprintf(str,
04883                           "Client %s (PID %d) on %s removed (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
04884                           pdbclient->name, client_pid, pdbheader->name,
04885                           (actual_time - pdbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
04886                           pdbclient->watchdog_timeout / 1000.0);
04887 
04888                   /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
04889                   for (k = 0; k < pdbclient->max_index; k++)
04890                      if (pdbclient->open_record[k].handle) {
04891                         pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pdbheader +
04892                                         pdbclient->open_record[k].handle);
04893                         if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
04894                            pkey->notify_count--;
04895 
04896                         if (pdbclient->open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
04897                            db_set_mode(i + 1, pdbclient->open_record[k].handle,
04898                                        (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
04899                      }
04900 
04901                   /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
04902                   memset(&(pdbheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
04903 
04904                   /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
04905                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
04906                      if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04907                         break;
04908                   pdbheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
04909 
04910                   /* count new number of clients */
04911                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
04912                      if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04913                         nc++;
04914                   pdbheader->num_clients = nc;
04915                   bDeleted = TRUE;
04916                }
04917 
04918                /* delete client entry before unlocking db */
04919                if (bDeleted) {
04920                   status = cm_delete_client_info(i + 1, client_pid);
04921                   if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
04922                      cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_watchdog", "cannot delete client info");
04923                }
04924 
04925                db_unlock_database(i + 1);
04926 
04927                /* display info message after unlocking db */
04928                if (str[0])
04929                   cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_watchdog", str);
04930             }
04931       }
04932 
04933    _watchdog_last_called = actual_time;
04934 
04935    ss_set_async_flag(FALSE);
04936 
04937    /* Schedule next watchdog call */
04938    if (_call_watchdog)
04939       ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
04940 }
04941 
04942 /********************************************************************/
04949 INT cm_enable_watchdog(BOOL flag)
04950 {
04951    static INT timeout = DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT;
04952    static BOOL call_flag = FALSE;
04953 
04954    if (flag) {
04955       if (call_flag)
04956          cm_set_watchdog_params(TRUE, timeout);
04957    } else {
04958       call_flag = _call_watchdog;
04959       timeout = _watchdog_timeout;
04960       if (call_flag)
04961          cm_set_watchdog_params(FALSE, 0);
04962    }
04963 
04964    return CM_SUCCESS;
04965 }
04966 
04967 #endif                          /* local routines */
04968 
04969 /********************************************************************/
04979 INT cm_shutdown(char *name, BOOL bUnique)
04980 {
04981    INT status, return_status, i, size;
04982    HNDLE hDB, hKeyClient, hKey, hSubkey, hKeyTmp, hConn;
04983    KEY key;
04984    char client_name[NAME_LENGTH], remote_host[HOST_NAME_LENGTH], str[256];
04985    INT port;
04986    DWORD start_time;
04987 
04988    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKeyClient);
04989 
04990    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hKey);
04991    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
04992       return DB_NO_KEY;
04993 
04994    return_status = CM_NO_CLIENT;
04995 
04996    /* loop over all clients */
04997    for (i = 0;; i++) {
04998       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
04999       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
05000          break;
05001 
05002       /* don't shutdown ourselves */
05003       if (hSubkey == hKeyClient)
05004          continue;
05005 
05006       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
05007          db_get_key(hDB, hSubkey, &key);
05008 
05009          /* contact client */
05010          size = sizeof(client_name);
05011          db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", client_name, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
05012 
05013          if (!bUnique)
05014             client_name[strlen(name)] = 0;      /* strip number */
05015 
05016          /* check if individual client */
05017          if (!equal_ustring("all", name) && !equal_ustring(client_name, name))
05018             continue;
05019 
05020          size = sizeof(port);
05021          db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Server Port", &port, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
05022 
05023          size = sizeof(remote_host);
05024          db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Host", remote_host, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
05025 
05026          /* client found -> connect to its server port */
05027          status = rpc_client_connect(remote_host, port, client_name, &hConn);
05028          if (status != RPC_SUCCESS) {
05029             return_status = CM_NO_CLIENT;
05030             sprintf(str, "cannot connect to client %s on host %s, port %d",
05031                     client_name, remote_host, port);
05032             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_shutdown", str);
05033          } else {
05034             /* call disconnect with shutdown=TRUE */
05035             rpc_client_disconnect(hConn, TRUE);
05036 
05037             /* wait until client has shut down */
05038             start_time = ss_millitime();
05039             do {
05040                ss_sleep(100);
05041                status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, key.name, &hKeyTmp);
05042             } while (status == DB_SUCCESS && (ss_millitime() - start_time < 5000));
05043 
05044             if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
05045                cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_shutdown",
05046                       "Cannot shutdown client \"%s\", please kill manually and do an ODB cleanup",
05047                       client_name);
05048                return_status = CM_NO_CLIENT;
05049             } else {
05050                return_status = CM_SUCCESS;
05051                i--;
05052             }
05053          }
05054       }
05055    }
05056 
05057    return return_status;
05058 }
05059 
05060 /********************************************************************/
05069 INT cm_exist(char *name, BOOL bUnique)
05070 {
05071    INT status, i, size;
05072    HNDLE hDB, hKeyClient, hKey, hSubkey;
05073    char client_name[NAME_LENGTH];
05074 
05075    if (rpc_is_remote())
05076       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_EXIST, name, bUnique);
05077 
05078    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKeyClient);
05079 
05080    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hKey);
05081    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05082       return DB_NO_KEY;
05083 
05084    /* loop over all clients */
05085    for (i = 0;; i++) {
05086       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
05087       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
05088          break;
05089 
05090       if (hSubkey == hKeyClient)
05091          continue;
05092 
05093       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
05094          /* get client name */
05095          size = sizeof(client_name);
05096          db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", client_name, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
05097 
05098          if (equal_ustring(client_name, name))
05099             return CM_SUCCESS;
05100 
05101          if (!bUnique) {
05102             client_name[strlen(name)] = 0;      /* strip number */
05103             if (equal_ustring(client_name, name))
05104                return CM_SUCCESS;
05105          }
05106       }
05107    }
05108 
05109    return CM_NO_CLIENT;
05110 }
05111 
05112 /********************************************************************/
05147 INT cm_cleanup(char *client_name, BOOL ignore_timeout)
05148 {
05149    if (rpc_is_remote())
05150       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_CLEANUP, client_name);
05151 
05152 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05153    {
05154       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader = NULL;
05155       BUFFER_CLIENT *pbclient, *pbctmp;
05156       DATABASE_HEADER *pdbheader;
05157       DATABASE_CLIENT *pdbclient;
05158       KEY *pkey;
05159       INT client_pid;
05160       INT i, j, k, status, nc;
05161       BOOL bDeleted;
05162       char str[256];
05163       DWORD interval;
05164 
05165       /* check buffers */
05166       for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
05167          if (_buffer[i].attached) {
05168             /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
05169             pheader = _buffer[i].buffer_header;
05170             pbclient = pheader->client;
05171             pbclient[_buffer[i].client_index].last_activity = ss_millitime();
05172 
05173             /* now check other clients */
05174             for (j = 0; j < pheader->max_client_index; j++, pbclient++)
05175                if (j != _buffer[i].client_index && pbclient->pid &&
05176                    (client_name[0] == 0
05177                     || strncmp(pbclient->name, client_name, strlen(client_name)) == 0)) {
05178                   if (ignore_timeout)
05179                      interval = 2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
05180                   else
05181                      interval = pbclient->watchdog_timeout;
05182 
05183                   /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
05184                   if (ss_millitime() - pbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05185                      bm_lock_buffer(i + 1);
05186                      str[0] = 0;
05187 
05188                      /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
05189                      if (ss_millitime() - pbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05190                         sprintf(str,
05191                                 "Client %s on %s removed (via cleanup) (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
05192                                 pbclient->name, pheader->name,
05193                                 (ss_millitime() - pbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
05194                                 interval / 1000.0);
05195 
05196                         /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
05197                         memset(&(pheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT));
05198 
05199                         /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
05200                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
05201                            if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05202                               break;
05203                         pheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
05204 
05205                         /* count new number of clients */
05206                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
05207                            if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05208                               nc++;
05209                         pheader->num_clients = nc;
05210 
05211                         /* check if anyone is wating and wake him up */
05212                         pbctmp = pheader->client;
05213 
05214                         for (k = 0; k < pheader->max_client_index; k++, pbctmp++)
05215                            if (pbctmp->pid && (pbctmp->write_wait || pbctmp->read_wait))
05216                               ss_resume(pbctmp->port, "B  ");
05217 
05218                      }
05219 
05220                      bm_unlock_buffer(i + 1);
05221 
05222                      /* display info message after unlocking buffer */
05223                      if (str[0])
05224                         cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_cleanup", str);
05225 
05226                      /* go again through whole list */
05227                      j = 0;
05228                   }
05229                }
05230          }
05231 
05232       /* check online databases */
05233       for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
05234          if (_database[i].attached) {
05235             /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
05236             db_lock_database(i + 1);
05237 
05238             pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
05239             pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
05240             pdbclient[_database[i].client_index].last_activity = ss_millitime();
05241 
05242             /* now check other clients */
05243             for (j = 0; j < pdbheader->max_client_index; j++, pdbclient++)
05244                if (j != _database[i].client_index && pdbclient->pid &&
05245                    (client_name[0] == 0
05246                     || strncmp(pdbclient->name, client_name, strlen(client_name)) == 0)) {
05247                   client_pid = pdbclient->tid;
05248                   if (ignore_timeout)
05249                      interval = 2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
05250                   else
05251                      interval = pdbclient->watchdog_timeout;
05252 
05253                   /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
05254 
05255                   if (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05256                      bDeleted = FALSE;
05257                      str[0] = 0;
05258 
05259                      /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
05260                      if (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05261                         sprintf(str,
05262                                 "Client %s on %s removed (via cleanup) (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
05263                                 pdbclient->name, pdbheader->name,
05264                                 (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
05265                                 interval / 1000.0);
05266 
05267                         /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
05268                         for (k = 0; k < pdbclient->max_index; k++)
05269                            if (pdbclient->open_record[k].handle) {
05270                               pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pdbheader +
05271                                               pdbclient->open_record[k].handle);
05272                               if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
05273                                  pkey->notify_count--;
05274 
05275                               if (pdbclient->open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
05276                                  db_set_mode(i + 1, pdbclient->open_record[k].handle,
05277                                              (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE),
05278                                              2);
05279                            }
05280 
05281                         /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
05282                         memset(&(pdbheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
05283 
05284                         /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
05285                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
05286                            if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05287                               break;
05288                         pdbheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
05289 
05290                         /* count new number of clients */
05291                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
05292                            if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05293                               nc++;
05294                         pdbheader->num_clients = nc;
05295 
05296                         bDeleted = TRUE;
05297                      }
05298 
05299 
05300                      /* delete client entry after unlocking db */
05301                      if (bDeleted) {
05302                         db_unlock_database(i + 1);
05303 
05304                         /* display info message after unlocking buffer */
05305                         cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_cleanup", str);
05306 
05307                         status = cm_delete_client_info(i + 1, client_pid);
05308                         if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
05309                            cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_cleanup", "cannot delete client info");
05310 
05311                         /* re-lock database */
05312                         db_lock_database(i + 1);
05313                         pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
05314                         pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
05315 
05316                         /* go again though whole list */
05317                         j = 0;
05318                      }
05319                   }
05320                }
05321 
05322             db_unlock_database(i + 1);
05323          }
05324 
05325    }
05326 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05327 
05328    return CM_SUCCESS;
05329 }
05330 
05332 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
05333 
05334 /********************************************************************/
05335 INT bm_get_buffer_info(INT buffer_handle, BUFFER_HEADER * buffer_header)
05336 /********************************************************************\
05337 
05338   Routine: bm_buffer_info
05339 
05340   Purpose: Copies the current buffer header referenced by buffer_handle
05341            into the *buffer_header structure which must be supplied
05342            by the calling routine.
05343 
05344   Input:
05345     INT buffer_handle       Handle of the buffer to get the header from
05346 
05347   Output:
05348     BUFFER_HEADER *buffer_header   Destination address which gets a copy
05349                                    of the buffer header structure.
05350 
05351   Function value:
05352     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05353     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05354     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
05355 
05356 \********************************************************************/
05357 {
05358    if (rpc_is_remote())
05359       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_GET_BUFFER_INFO, buffer_handle, buffer_header);
05360 
05361 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05362 
05363    if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05364       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_get_buffer_info", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05365       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05366    }
05367 
05368    if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
05369       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_get_buffer_info", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05370       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05371    }
05372 
05373    bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05374 
05375    memcpy(buffer_header, _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header, sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER));
05376 
05377    bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05378 
05379 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05380 
05381    return BM_SUCCESS;
05382 }
05383 
05384 /********************************************************************/
05385 INT bm_get_buffer_level(INT buffer_handle, INT * n_bytes)
05386 /********************************************************************\
05387 
05388   Routine: bm_get_buffer_level
05389 
05390   Purpose: Return number of bytes in buffer or in cache
05391 
05392   Input:
05393     INT buffer_handle       Handle of the buffer to get the info
05394 
05395   Output:
05396     INT *n_bytes              Number of bytes in buffer
05397 
05398   Function value:
05399     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05400     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05401     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
05402 
05403 \********************************************************************/
05404 {
05405    if (rpc_is_remote())
05406       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_GET_BUFFER_LEVEL, buffer_handle, n_bytes);
05407 
05408 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05409    {
05410       BUFFER *pbuf;
05411       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
05412       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
05413 
05414       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05415          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_get_buffer_level", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05416          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05417       }
05418 
05419       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
05420       pheader = pbuf->buffer_header;
05421 
05422       if (!pbuf->attached) {
05423          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_get_buffer_level", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05424          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05425       }
05426 
05427       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05428 
05429       pclient = &(pheader->client[_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].client_index]);
05430 
05431       *n_bytes = pheader->write_pointer - pclient->read_pointer;
05432       if (*n_bytes < 0)
05433          *n_bytes += pheader->size;
05434 
05435       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05436 
05437       /* add bytes in cache */
05438       if (pbuf->read_cache_wp > pbuf->read_cache_rp)
05439          *n_bytes += pbuf->read_cache_wp - pbuf->read_cache_rp;
05440    }
05441 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05442 
05443    return BM_SUCCESS;
05444 }
05445 
05446 
05447 
05448 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05449 
05450 /********************************************************************/
05451 INT bm_lock_buffer(INT buffer_handle)
05452 /********************************************************************\
05453 
05454   Routine: bm_lock_buffer
05455 
05456   Purpose: Lock a buffer for exclusive access via system mutex calls.
05457 
05458   Input:
05459     INT    bufer_handle     Handle to the buffer to lock
05460   Output:
05461     none
05462 
05463   Function value:
05464     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05465     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05466 
05467 \********************************************************************/
05468 {
05469    if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05470       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_lock_buffer", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05471       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05472    }
05473 
05474    ss_mutex_wait_for(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].mutex, 0);
05475    return BM_SUCCESS;
05476 }
05477 
05478 /********************************************************************/
05479 INT bm_unlock_buffer(INT buffer_handle)
05480 /********************************************************************\
05481 
05482   Routine: bm_unlock_buffer
05483 
05484   Purpose: Unlock a buffer via system mutex calls.
05485 
05486   Input:
05487     INT    bufer_handle     Handle to the buffer to lock
05488   Output:
05489     none
05490 
05491   Function value:
05492     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05493     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05494 
05495 \********************************************************************/
05496 {
05497    if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05498       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_unlock_buffer", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05499       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05500    }
05501 
05502    ss_mutex_release(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].mutex);
05503    return BM_SUCCESS;
05504 }
05505 
05506 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05507 
05508 /********************************************************************/
05509 INT bm_init_buffer_counters(INT buffer_handle)
05510 /********************************************************************\
05511 
05512   Routine: bm_init_event_counters
05513 
05514   Purpose: Initialize counters for a specific buffer. This routine
05515            should be called at the beginning of a run.
05516 
05517   Input:
05518     INT    buffer_handle    Handle to the buffer to be
05519                             initialized.
05520   Output:
05521     none
05522 
05523   Function value:
05524     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05525     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05526 
05527 \********************************************************************/
05528 {
05529    if (rpc_is_remote())
05530       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_INIT_BUFFER_COUNTERS, buffer_handle);
05531 
05532 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05533 
05534    if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05535       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_init_buffer_counters", "invalid buffer handle %d",
05536              buffer_handle);
05537       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05538    }
05539 
05540    if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
05541       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_init_buffer_counters", "invalid buffer handle %d",
05542              buffer_handle);
05543       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05544    }
05545 
05546    _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header->num_in_events = 0;
05547    _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header->num_out_events = 0;
05548 
05549 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05550 
05551    return BM_SUCCESS;
05552 }
05553 
05555 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
05556  /* end of cmfunctionc */
05559 
05565 /********************************************************************/
05589 INT bm_set_cache_size(INT buffer_handle, INT read_size, INT write_size)
05590 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05591 {
05592    if (rpc_is_remote())
05593       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_SET_CACHE_SIZE, buffer_handle, read_size, write_size);
05594 
05595 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05596    {
05597       BUFFER *pbuf;
05598 
05599       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05600          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05601          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05602       }
05603 
05604       if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
05605          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05606          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05607       }
05608 
05609       if (read_size < 0 || read_size > 1E6) {
05610          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid read chache size");
05611          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
05612       }
05613 
05614       if (write_size < 0 || write_size > 1E6) {
05615          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid write chache size");
05616          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
05617       }
05618 
05619       /* manage read cache */
05620       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
05621 
05622       if (pbuf->read_cache_size > 0)
05623          M_FREE(pbuf->read_cache);
05624 
05625       if (read_size > 0) {
05626          pbuf->read_cache = (char *) M_MALLOC(read_size);
05627          if (pbuf->read_cache == NULL) {
05628             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size",
05629                    "not enough memory to allocate cache buffer");
05630             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
05631          }
05632       }
05633 
05634       pbuf->read_cache_size = read_size;
05635       pbuf->read_cache_rp = pbuf->read_cache_wp = 0;
05636 
05637       /* manage write cache */
05638       if (pbuf->write_cache_size > 0)
05639          M_FREE(pbuf->write_cache);
05640 
05641       if (write_size > 0) {
05642          pbuf->write_cache = (char *) M_MALLOC(write_size);
05643          if (pbuf->write_cache == NULL) {
05644             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size",
05645                    "not enough memory to allocate cache buffer");
05646             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
05647          }
05648       }
05649 
05650       pbuf->write_cache_size = write_size;
05651       pbuf->write_cache_rp = pbuf->write_cache_wp = 0;
05652 
05653    }
05654 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05655 
05656    return BM_SUCCESS;
05657 }
05658 
05659 /********************************************************************/
05686 INT bm_compose_event(EVENT_HEADER * event_header,
05687                      short int event_id, short int trigger_mask, DWORD size, DWORD serial)
05688 {
05689    event_header->event_id = event_id;
05690    event_header->trigger_mask = trigger_mask;
05691    event_header->data_size = size;
05692    event_header->time_stamp = ss_time();
05693    event_header->serial_number = serial;
05694 
05695    return BM_SUCCESS;
05696 }
05697 
05698 
05700 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
05701 
05702 /********************************************************************/
05703 INT bm_add_event_request(INT buffer_handle, short int event_id,
05704                          short int trigger_mask,
05705                          INT sampling_type,
05706                          void (*func) (HNDLE, HNDLE, EVENT_HEADER *, void *),
05707                          INT request_id)
05708 /********************************************************************\
05709 
05710   Routine:  bm_add_event_request
05711 
05712   Purpose:  Place a request for a specific event type in the client
05713             structure of the buffer refereced by buffer_handle.
05714 
05715   Input:
05716     INT          buffer_handle  Handle to the buffer where the re-
05717                                 quest should be placed in
05718 
05719     short int    event_id       Event ID      \
05720     short int    trigger_mask   Trigger mask  / Event specification
05721 
05722     INT          sampling_type  One of GET_ALL, GET_SOME or GET_FARM
05723 
05724 
05725                  Note: to request all types of events, use
05726                    event_id = 0 (all others should be !=0 !)
05727                    trigger_mask = TRIGGER_ALL
05728                    sampling_typ = GET_ALL
05729 
05730 
05731     void         *func          Callback function
05732     INT          request_id     Request id (unique number assigned
05733                                 by bm_request_event)
05734 
05735   Output:
05736     none
05737 
05738   Function value:
05739     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05740     BM_NO_MEMORY            Too much request. MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS in
05741                             MIDAS.H should be increased.
05742     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05743     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
05744 
05745 \********************************************************************/
05746 {
05747    if (rpc_is_remote())
05748       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_ADD_EVENT_REQUEST, buffer_handle, event_id,
05749                       trigger_mask, sampling_type, (INT) func, request_id);
05750 
05751 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05752    {
05753       INT i;
05754       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
05755 
05756       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05757          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_add_event_request", "invalid buffer handle %d",
05758                 buffer_handle);
05759          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05760       }
05761 
05762       if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
05763          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_add_event_request", "invalid buffer handle %d",
05764                 buffer_handle);
05765          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05766       }
05767 
05768       /* avoid callback/non callback requests */
05769       if (func == NULL && _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].callback) {
05770          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_add_event_request",
05771                 "mixing callback/non callback requests not possible");
05772          return BM_INVALID_MIXING;
05773       }
05774 
05775       /* get a pointer to the proper client structure */
05776       pclient = &(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header->
05777                   client[_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].client_index]);
05778 
05779       /* lock buffer */
05780       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05781 
05782       /* look for a empty request entry */
05783       for (i = 0; i < MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS; i++)
05784          if (!pclient->event_request[i].valid)
05785             break;
05786 
05787       if (i == MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS) {
05788          bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05789          return BM_NO_MEMORY;
05790       }
05791 
05792       /* setup event_request structure */
05793       pclient->event_request[i].id = request_id;
05794       pclient->event_request[i].valid = TRUE;
05795       pclient->event_request[i].event_id = event_id;
05796       pclient->event_request[i].trigger_mask = trigger_mask;
05797       pclient->event_request[i].sampling_type = sampling_type;
05798       pclient->event_request[i].dispatch = func;
05799 
05800       pclient->all_flag = pclient->all_flag || (sampling_type & GET_ALL);
05801 
05802       /* set callback flag in buffer structure */
05803       if (func != NULL)
05804          _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].callback = TRUE;
05805 
05806       /*
05807          Save the index of the last request in the list so that later only the
05808          requests 0..max_request_index-1 have to be searched through.
05809        */
05810 
05811       if (i + 1 > pclient->max_request_index)
05812          pclient->max_request_index = i + 1;
05813 
05814       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05815    }
05816 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05817 
05818    return BM_SUCCESS;
05819 }
05820 
05822 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
05823 
05824 /********************************************************************/
05852 INT bm_request_event(HNDLE buffer_handle, short int event_id,
05853                      short int trigger_mask,
05854                      INT sampling_type, HNDLE * request_id,
05855                      void (*func) (HNDLE, HNDLE, EVENT_HEADER *, void *))
05856 {
05857    INT index, status;
05858 
05859    /* allocate new space for the local request list */
05860    if (_request_list_entries == 0) {
05861       _request_list = (REQUEST_LIST *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(REQUEST_LIST));
05862       memset(_request_list, 0, sizeof(REQUEST_LIST));
05863       if (_request_list == NULL) {
05864          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_request_event",
05865                 "not enough memory to allocate request list buffer");
05866          return BM_NO_MEMORY;
05867       }
05868 
05869       _request_list_entries = 1;
05870       index = 0;
05871    } else {
05872       /* check for a deleted entry */
05873       for (index = 0; index < _request_list_entries; index++)
05874          if (!_request_list[index].buffer_handle)
05875             break;
05876 
05877       /* if not found, create new one */
05878       if (index == _request_list_entries) {
05879          _request_list = (REQUEST_LIST *) realloc(_request_list,
05880                                                   sizeof(REQUEST_LIST) *
05881                                                   (_request_list_entries + 1));
05882          if (_request_list == NULL) {
05883             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_request_event",
05884                    "not enough memory to allocate request list buffer");
05885             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
05886          }
05887 
05888          memset(&_request_list[_request_list_entries], 0, sizeof(REQUEST_LIST));
05889 
05890          _request_list_entries++;
05891       }
05892    }
05893 
05894    /* initialize request list */
05895    _request_list[index].buffer_handle = buffer_handle;
05896    _request_list[index].event_id = event_id;
05897    _request_list[index].trigger_mask = trigger_mask;
05898    _request_list[index].dispatcher = func;
05899 
05900    *request_id = index;
05901 
05902    /* add request in buffer structure */
05903    status = bm_add_event_request(buffer_handle, event_id, trigger_mask,
05904                                  sampling_type, func, index);
05905    if (status != BM_SUCCESS)
05906       return status;
05907 
05908    return BM_SUCCESS;
05909 }
05910 
05911 /********************************************************************/
05920 INT bm_remove_event_request(INT buffer_handle, INT request_id)
05921 {
05922    if (rpc_is_remote())
05923       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_REMOVE_EVENT_REQUEST, buffer_handle, request_id);
05924 
05925 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05926    {
05927       INT i, deleted;
05928       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
05929 
05930       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05931          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_remove_event_request", "invalid buffer handle %d",
05932                 buffer_handle);
05933          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05934       }
05935 
05936       if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
05937          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_remove_event_request", "invalid buffer handle %d",
05938                 buffer_handle);
05939          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05940       }
05941 
05942       /* get a pointer to the proper client structure */
05943       pclient = &(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header->
05944                   client[_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].client_index]);
05945 
05946       /* lock buffer */
05947       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05948 
05949       /* check all requests and set to zero if matching */
05950       for (i = 0, deleted = 0; i < pclient->max_request_index; i++)
05951          if (pclient->event_request[i].valid &&
05952              pclient->event_request[i].id == request_id) {
05953             memset(&pclient->event_request[i], 0, sizeof(EVENT_REQUEST));
05954             deleted++;
05955          }
05956 
05957       /* calculate new max_request_index entry */
05958       for (i = MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS - 1; i >= 0; i--)
05959          if (pclient->event_request[i].valid)
05960             break;
05961 
05962       pclient->max_request_index = i + 1;
05963 
05964       /* caluclate new all_flag */
05965       pclient->all_flag = FALSE;
05966 
05967       for (i = 0; i < pclient->max_request_index; i++)
05968          if (pclient->event_request[i].valid &&
05969              (pclient->event_request[i].sampling_type & GET_ALL)) {
05970             pclient->all_flag = TRUE;
05971             break;
05972          }
05973 
05974       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05975 
05976       if (!deleted)
05977          return BM_NOT_FOUND;
05978    }
05979 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05980
