14940     HS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
14941     HS_FILE_ERROR           Cannot open history file
14942 
14943 \********************************************************************/
14944 {
14945    int fh;
14946    INT n;
14947    HIST_RECORD rec;
14948    char event_name[NAME_LENGTH];
14949    char str[80];
14950 
14951    /* open file, add O_BINARY flag for Windows NT */
14952    fh = open(file_name, O_RDONLY | O_BINARY, 0644);
14953    if (fh < 0) {
14954       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_fdump", "cannot open file %s", file_name);
14955       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14956    }
14957 
14958    /* loop over file records in .hst file */
14959    do {
14960       n = read(fh, (char *) &rec, sizeof(rec));
14961       if (n < sizeof(rec))
14962          break;
14963 
14964       /* check if record type is definition */
14965       if (rec.record_type == RT_DEF) {
14966          /* read name */
14967          read(fh, event_name, sizeof(event_name));
14968 
14969          if (rec.event_id == id || id == 0)
14970             printf("Event definition %s, ID %ld\n", event_name, rec.event_id);
14971 
14972          /* skip tags */
14973          lseek(fh, rec.data_size, SEEK_CUR);
14974       } else {
14975          /* print data record */
14976          if (binary_time)
14977             sprintf(str, "%li ", rec.time);
14978          else {
14979             strcpy(str, ctime((const time_t *) &rec.time) + 4);
14980             str[15] = 0;
14981          }
14982          if (rec.event_id == id || id == 0)
14983             printf("ID %ld, %s, size %ld\n", rec.event_id, str, rec.data_size);
14984 
14985          /* skip data */
14986          lseek(fh, rec.data_size, SEEK_CUR);
14987       }
14988 
14989    } while (TRUE);
14990 
14991    close(fh);
14992 
14993    return HS_SUCCESS;
14994 }
14995 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS hs section */
14996 
14998 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
14999  /* end of hsfunctionc */
15002 
15009 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
15010 
15011 /********************************************************************\
15012 *                                                                    *
15013 *               Electronic logbook functions                         *
15014 *                                                                    *
15015 \********************************************************************/
15016 
15017 /********************************************************************/
15018 void el_decode(char *message, char *key, char *result, int size)
15019 {
15020    char *rstart = result;
15021    char *pc;
15022 
15023    if (result == NULL)
15024       return;
15025 
15026    *result = 0;
15027 
15028    if (strstr(message, key)) {
15029       for (pc = strstr(message, key) + strlen(key); *pc != '\n';)
15030          *result++ = *pc++;
15031       *result = 0;
15032    }
15033 
15034    assert((int)strlen(rstart) < size);
15035 }
15036 
15038 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
15039 
15040 /********************************************************************/
15064 INT el_submit(int run, char *author, char *type, char *system, char *subject,
15065               char *text, char *reply_to, char *encoding,
15066               char *afilename1, char *buffer1, INT buffer_size1,
15067               char *afilename2, char *buffer2, INT buffer_size2,
15068               char *afilename3, char *buffer3, INT buffer_size3, char *tag, INT tag_size)
15069 {
15070    if (rpc_is_remote())
15071       return rpc_call(RPC_EL_SUBMIT, run, author, type, system, subject,
15072                       text, reply_to, encoding,
15073                       afilename1, buffer1, buffer_size1,
15074                       afilename2, buffer2, buffer_size2,
15075                       afilename3, buffer3, buffer_size3, tag, tag_size);
15076 
15077 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
15078    {
15079       INT n, size, fh, status, run_number, mutex, buffer_size = 0, index, offset =
15080           0, tail_size = 0;
15081       struct tm *tms = NULL;
15082       char afilename[256], file_name[256], afile_name[3][256], dir[256], str[256],
15083           start_str[80], end_str[80], last[80], date[80], thread[80], attachment[256];
15084       HNDLE hDB;
15085       time_t now;
15086       char message[10000], *p, *buffer = NULL;
15087       BOOL bedit;
15088 
15089       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
15090 
15091       bedit = (tag[0] != 0);
15092 
15093       /* request semaphore */
15094       cm_get_experiment_mutex(NULL, &mutex);
15095       ss_mutex_wait_for(mutex, 0);
15096 
15097       /* get run number from ODB if not given */
15098       if (run > 0)
15099          run_number = run;
15100       else {
15101          /* get run number */
15102          size = sizeof(run_number);
15103          status =
15104              db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, &size, TID_INT,
15105                           TRUE);
15106          assert(status == SUCCESS);
15107       }
15108 
15109       if (run_number < 0) {
15110          cm_msg(MERROR, "el_submit", "aborting on attempt to use invalid run number %d",
15111                 run_number);
15112          abort();
15113       }
15114 
15115       for (index = 0; index < 3; index++) {
15116          /* generate filename for attachment */
15117          afile_name[index][0] = file_name[0] = 0;
15118 
15119          if (index == 0) {
15120             strcpy(afilename, afilename1);
15121             buffer = buffer1;
15122             buffer_size = buffer_size1;
15123          } else if (index == 1) {
15124             strcpy(afilename, afilename2);
15125             buffer = buffer2;
15126             buffer_size = buffer_size2;
15127          } else if (index == 2) {
15128             strcpy(afilename, afilename3);
15129             buffer = buffer3;
15130             buffer_size = buffer_size3;
15131          }
15132 
15133          if (afilename[0]) {
15134             strcpy(file_name, afilename);
15135             p = file_name;
15136             while (strchr(p, ':'))
15137                p = strchr(p, ':') + 1;
15138             while (strchr(p, '\\'))
15139                p = strchr(p, '\\') + 1; /* NT */
15140             while (strchr(p, '/'))
15141                p = strchr(p, '/') + 1;  /* Unix */
15142             while (strchr(p, ']'))
15143                p = strchr(p, ']') + 1;  /* VMS */
15144 
15145             /* assemble ELog filename */
15146             if (p[0]) {
15147                dir[0] = 0;
15148                if (hDB > 0) {
15149                   size = sizeof(dir);
15150                   memset(dir, 0, size);
15151                   status =
15152                       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Elog dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING,
15153                                    FALSE);
15154                   if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
15155                      db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING,
15156                                   TRUE);
15157 
15158                   if (dir[0] != 0 && dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
15159                      strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
15160                }
15161 #if !defined(OS_VXWORKS)
15162 #if !defined(OS_VMS)
15163                tzset();
15164 #endif
15165 #endif
15166 
15167                time((time_t *) & now);
15168                tms = localtime((const time_t *) &now);
15169 
15170                strcpy(str, p);
15171                sprintf(afile_name[index], "%02d%02d%02d_%02d%02d%02d_%s",
15172                        tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday,
15173                        tms->tm_hour, tms->tm_min, tms->tm_sec, str);
15174                sprintf(file_name, "%s%02d%02d%02d_%02d%02d%02d_%s", dir,
15175                        tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday,
15176                        tms->tm_hour, tms->tm_min, tms->tm_sec, str);
15177 
15178                /* save attachment */
15179                fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_RDWR | O_BINARY, 0644);
15180                if (fh < 0) {
15181                   cm_msg(MERROR, "el_submit", "Cannot write attachment file \"%s\"",
15182                          file_name);
15183                } else {
15184                   write(fh, buffer, buffer_size);
15185                   close(fh);
15186                }
15187             }
15188          }
15189       }
15190 
15191       /* generate new file name YYMMDD.log in data directory */
15192       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
15193 
15194       size = sizeof(dir);
15195       memset(dir, 0, size);
15196       status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Elog dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, FALSE);
15197       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
15198          db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
15199 
15200       if (dir[0] != 0 && dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
15201          strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
15202 
15203 #if !defined(OS_VXWORKS)
15204 #if !defined(OS_VMS)
15205       tzset();
15206 #endif
15207 #endif
15208 
15209       if (bedit) {
15210          /* edit existing message */
15211          strcpy(str, tag);
15212          if (strchr(str, '.')) {
15213             offset = atoi(strchr(str, '.') + 1);
15214             *strchr(str, '.') = 0;
15215          }
15216          sprintf(file_name, "%s%s.log", dir, str);
15217          fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_RDWR | O_BINARY, 0644);
15218          if (fh < 0) {
15219             ss_mutex_release(mutex);
15220             return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15221          }
15222          lseek(fh, offset, SEEK_SET);
15223          read(fh, str, 16);
15224          size = atoi(str + 9);
15225          read(fh, message, size);
15226 
15227          el_decode(message, "Date: ", date, sizeof(date));
15228          el_decode(message, "Thread: ", thread, sizeof(thread));
15229          el_decode(message, "Attachment: ", attachment, sizeof(attachment));
15230 
15231          /* buffer tail of logfile */
15232          lseek(fh, 0, SEEK_END);
15233          tail_size = TELL(fh) - (offset + size);
15234 
15235          if (tail_size > 0) {
15236             buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(tail_size);
15237             if (buffer == NULL) {
15238                close(fh);
15239                ss_mutex_release(mutex);
15240                return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15241             }
15242 
15243             lseek(fh, offset + size, SEEK_SET);
15244             n = read(fh, buffer, tail_size);
15245          }
15246          lseek(fh, offset, SEEK_SET);
15247       } else {
15248          /* create new message */
15249          time((time_t *) & now);
15250          tms = localtime((const time_t *) &now);
15251 
15252          sprintf(file_name, "%s%02d%02d%02d.log", dir,
15253                  tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday);
15254 
15255          fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_RDWR | O_BINARY, 0644);
15256          if (fh < 0) {
15257             ss_mutex_release(mutex);
15258             return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15259          }
15260 
15261          strcpy(date, ctime(&now));
15262          date[24] = 0;
15263 
15264          if (reply_to[0])
15265             sprintf(thread, "%16s %16s", reply_to, "0");
15266          else
15267             sprintf(thread, "%16s %16s", "0", "0");
15268 
15269          lseek(fh, 0, SEEK_END);
15270       }
15271 
15272       /* compose message */
15273 
15274       sprintf(message, "Date: %s\n", date);
15275       sprintf(message + strlen(message), "Thread: %s\n", thread);
15276       sprintf(message + strlen(message), "Run: %d\n", run_number);
15277       sprintf(message + strlen(message), "Author: %s\n", author);
15278       sprintf(message + strlen(message), "Type: %s\n", type);
15279       sprintf(message + strlen(message), "System: %s\n", system);
15280       sprintf(message + strlen(message), "Subject: %s\n", subject);
15281 
15282       /* keep original attachment if edit and no new attachment */
15283       if (bedit && afile_name[0][0] == 0 && afile_name[1][0] == 0 &&
15284           afile_name[2][0] == 0)
15285          sprintf(message + strlen(message), "Attachment: %s", attachment);
15286       else {
15287          sprintf(message + strlen(message), "Attachment: %s", afile_name[0]);
15288          if (afile_name[1][0])
15289             sprintf(message + strlen(message), ",%s", afile_name[1]);
15290          if (afile_name[2][0])
15291             sprintf(message + strlen(message), ",%s", afile_name[2]);
15292       }
15293       sprintf(message + strlen(message), "\n");
15294 
15295       sprintf(message + strlen(message), "Encoding: %s\n", encoding);
15296       sprintf(message + strlen(message), "========================================\n");
15297       strcat(message, text);
15298 
15299       assert(strlen(message) < sizeof(message)); /* bomb out on array overrun. */
15300 
15301       size = 0;
15302       sprintf(start_str, "$Start$: %6d\n", size);
15303       sprintf(end_str, "$End$:   %6d\n\f", size);
15304 
15305       size = strlen(message) + strlen(start_str) + strlen(end_str);
15306 
15307       if (tag != NULL && !bedit)
15308          sprintf(tag, "%02d%02d%02d.%d", tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1,
15309                  tms->tm_mday, (int) TELL(fh));
15310 
15311       /* size has to fit in 6 digits */
15312       assert(size < 999999);
15313 
15314       sprintf(start_str, "$Start$: %6d\n", size);
15315       sprintf(end_str, "$End$:   %6d\n\f", size);
15316 
15317       write(fh, start_str, strlen(start_str));
15318       write(fh, message, strlen(message));
15319       write(fh, end_str, strlen(end_str));
15320 
15321       if (bedit) {
15322          if (tail_size > 0) {
15323             n = write(fh, buffer, tail_size);
15324             M_FREE(buffer);
15325          }
15326 
15327          /* truncate file here */
15328 #ifdef OS_WINNT
15329          chsize(fh, TELL(fh));
15330 #else
15331          ftruncate(fh, TELL(fh));
15332 #endif
15333       }
15334 
15335       close(fh);
15336 
15337       /* if reply, mark original message */
15338       if (reply_to[0] && !bedit) {
15339          strcpy(last, reply_to);
15340          do {
15341             status = el_search_message(last, &fh, FALSE);
15342             if (status == EL_SUCCESS) {
15343                /* position to next thread location */
15344                lseek(fh, 72, SEEK_CUR);
15345                memset(str, 0, sizeof(str));
15346                read(fh, str, 16);
15347                lseek(fh, -16, SEEK_CUR);
15348 
15349                /* if no reply yet, set it */
15350                if (atoi(str) == 0) {
15351                   sprintf(str, "%16s", tag);
15352                   write(fh, str, 16);
15353                   close(fh);
15354                   break;
15355                } else {
15356                   /* if reply set, find last one in chain */
15357                   strcpy(last, strtok(str, " "));
15358                   close(fh);
15359                }
15360             } else
15361                /* stop on error */
15362                break;
15363 
15364          } while (TRUE);
15365       }
15366 
15367       /* release elog mutex */
15368       ss_mutex_release(mutex);
15369    }
15370 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
15371 
15372    return EL_SUCCESS;
15373 }
15374 
15376 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
15377 
15378 /********************************************************************/
15379 INT el_search_message(char *tag, int *fh, BOOL walk)
15380 {
15381    int i, size, offset, direction, last, status;
15382    struct tm *tms, ltms;
15383    DWORD lt, ltime, lact;
15384    char str[256], file_name[256], dir[256];
15385    HNDLE hDB;
15386 
15387 #if !defined(OS_VXWORKS)
15388 #if !defined(OS_VMS)
15389    tzset();
15390 #endif
15391 #endif
15392 
15393    /* open file */
15394    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
15395 
15396    size = sizeof(dir);
15397    memset(dir, 0, size);
15398    status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Elog dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, FALSE);
15399    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
15400       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
15401 
15402    if (dir[0] != 0 && dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
15403       strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
15404 
15405    /* check tag for direction */
15406    direction = 0;
15407    if (strpbrk(tag, "+-")) {
15408       direction = atoi(strpbrk(tag, "+-"));
15409       *strpbrk(tag, "+-") = 0;
15410    }
15411 
15412    /* if tag is given, open file directly */
15413    if (tag[0]) {
15414       /* extract time structure from tag */
15415       tms = &ltms;
15416       memset(tms, 0, sizeof(struct tm));
15417       tms->tm_year = (tag[0] - '0') * 10 + (tag[1] - '0');
15418       tms->tm_mon = (tag[2] - '0') * 10 + (tag[3] - '0') - 1;
15419       tms->tm_mday = (tag[4] - '0') * 10 + (tag[5] - '0');
15420       tms->tm_hour = 12;
15421 
15422       if (tms->tm_year < 90)
15423          tms->tm_year += 100;
15424       ltime = lt = mktime(tms);
15425 
15426       strcpy(str, tag);
15427       if (strchr(str, '.')) {
15428          offset = atoi(strchr(str, '.') + 1);
15429          *strchr(str, '.') = 0;
15430       } else
15431          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15432 
15433       do {
15434          tms = localtime((const time_t *) &ltime);
15435 
15436          sprintf(file_name, "%s%02d%02d%02d.log", dir,
15437                  tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday);
15438          *fh = open(file_name, O_RDWR | O_BINARY, 0644);
15439 
15440          if (*fh < 0) {
15441             if (!walk)
15442                return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15443 
15444             if (direction == -1)
15445                ltime -= 3600 * 24;      /* one day back */
15446             else
15447                ltime += 3600 * 24;      /* go forward one day */
15448 
15449             /* set new tag */
15450             tms = localtime((const time_t *) &ltime);
15451             sprintf(tag, "%02d%02d%02d.0", tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1,
15452                     tms->tm_mday);
15453          }
15454 
15455          /* in forward direction, stop today */
15456          if (direction != -1 && ltime > (DWORD) time(NULL) + 3600 * 24)
15457             break;
15458 
15459          /* in backward direction, go back 10 years */
15460          if (direction == -1 && abs((INT) lt - (INT) ltime) > 3600 * 24 * 365 * 10)
15461             break;
15462 
15463       } while (*fh < 0);
15464 
15465       if (*fh < 0)
15466          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15467 
15468       lseek(*fh, offset, SEEK_SET);
15469 
15470       /* check if start of message */
15471       i = read(*fh, str, 15);
15472       if (i <= 0) {
15473          close(*fh);
15474          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15475       }
15476 
15477       if (strncmp(str, "$Start$: ", 9) != 0) {
15478          close(*fh);
15479          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15480       }
15481 
15482       lseek(*fh, offset, SEEK_SET);
15483    }
15484 
15485    /* open most recent file if no tag given */
15486    if (tag[0] == 0) {
15487       time((long *) &lt);
15488       ltime = lt;
15489       do {
15490          tms = localtime((const time_t *) &ltime);
15491 
15492          sprintf(file_name, "%s%02d%02d%02d.log", dir,
15493                  tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday);
15494          *fh = open(file_name, O_RDWR | O_BINARY, 0644);
15495 
15496          if (*fh < 0)
15497             ltime -= 3600 * 24; /* one day back */
15498 
15499       } while (*fh < 0 && (INT) lt - (INT) ltime < 3600 * 24 * 365);
15500 
15501       if (*fh < 0)
15502          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15503 
15504       /* remember tag */
15505       sprintf(tag, "%02d%02d%02d", tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday);
15506 
15507       lseek(*fh, 0, SEEK_END);
15508 
15509       sprintf(tag + strlen(tag), ".%d", (int) TELL(*fh));
15510    }
15511 
15512 
15513    if (direction == -1) {
15514       /* seek previous message */
15515 
15516       if (TELL(*fh) == 0) {
15517          /* go back one day */
15518          close(*fh);
15519 
15520          lt = ltime;
15521          do {
15522             lt -= 3600 * 24;
15523             tms = localtime((const time_t *) &lt);
15524             sprintf(str, "%02d%02d%02d.0",
15525                     tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday);
15526 
15527             status = el_search_message(str, fh, FALSE);
15528 
15529          } while (status != EL_SUCCESS && (INT) ltime - (INT) lt < 3600 * 24 * 365);
15530 
15531          if (status != EL_SUCCESS)
15532             return EL_FIRST_MSG;
15533 
15534          /* adjust tag */
15535          strcpy(tag, str);
15536 
15537          /* go to end of current file */
15538          lseek(*fh, 0, SEEK_END);
15539       }
15540 
15541       /* read previous message size */
15542       lseek(*fh, -17, SEEK_CUR);
15543       i = read(*fh, str, 17);
15544       if (i <= 0) {
15545          close(*fh);
15546          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15547       }
15548 
15549       if (strncmp(str, "$End$: ", 7) != 0) {
15550          close(*fh);
15551          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15552       }
15553         
15554       /* make sure the input string to atoi() is zero-terminated:
15555        * $End$:      355garbage
15556        * 01234567890123456789 */
15557       str[15] = 0;
15558 
15559       size = atoi(str + 7);
15560       assert(size > 15);
15561 
15562       lseek(*fh, -size, SEEK_CUR);
15563 
15564       /* adjust tag */
15565       sprintf(strchr(tag, '.') + 1, "%d", (int) TELL(*fh));
15566    }
15567 
15568    if (direction == 1) {
15569       /* seek next message */
15570 
15571       /* read current message size */
15572       last = TELL(*fh);
15573 
15574       i = read(*fh, str, 15);
15575       if (i <= 0) {
15576          close(*fh);
15577          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15578       }
15579       lseek(*fh, -15, SEEK_CUR);
15580 
15581       if (strncmp(str, "$Start$: ", 9) != 0) {
15582          close(*fh);
15583          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15584       }
15585 
15586       /* make sure the input string to atoi() is zero-terminated
15587        * $Start$:    606garbage
15588        * 01234567890123456789 */
15589       str[15] = 0;
15590 
15591       size = atoi(str+9);
15592       assert(size > 15);
15593 
15594       lseek(*fh, size, SEEK_CUR);
15595 
15596       /* if EOF, goto next day */
15597       i = read(*fh, str, 15);
15598       if (i < 15) {
15599          close(*fh);
15600          time((long *) &lact);
15601 
15602          lt = ltime;
15603          do {
15604             lt += 3600 * 24;
15605             tms = localtime((const time_t *) &lt);
15606             sprintf(str, "%02d%02d%02d.0",
15607                     tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday);
15608 
15609             status = el_search_message(str, fh, FALSE);
15610 
15611          } while (status != EL_SUCCESS && (INT) lt - (INT) lact < 3600 * 24);
15612 
15613          if (status != EL_SUCCESS)
15614             return EL_LAST_MSG;
15615 
15616          /* adjust tag */
15617          strcpy(tag, str);
15618 
15619          /* go to beginning of current file */
15620          lseek(*fh, 0, SEEK_SET);
15621       } else
15622          lseek(*fh, -15, SEEK_CUR);
15623 
15624       /* adjust tag */
15625       sprintf(strchr(tag, '.') + 1, "%d", (int) TELL(*fh));
15626    }
15627 
15628    return EL_SUCCESS;
15629 }
15630 
15631 
15632 /********************************************************************/
15633 INT el_retrieve(char *tag, char *date, int *run, char *author, char *type,
15634                 char *system, char *subject, char *text, int *textsize,
15635                 char *orig_tag, char *reply_tag,
15636                 char *attachment1, char *attachment2, char *attachment3, char *encoding)
15637 /********************************************************************\
15638 
15639   Routine: el_retrieve
15640 
15641   Purpose: Retrieve an ELog entry by its message tab
15642 
15643   Input:
15644     char   *tag             tag in the form YYMMDD.offset
15645     int    *size            Size of text buffer
15646 
15647   Output:
15648     char   *tag             tag of retrieved message
15649     char   *date            Date/time of message recording
15650     int    *run             Run number
15651     char   *author          Message author
15652     char   *type            Message type
15653     char   *system          Message system
15654     char   *subject         Subject
15655     char   *text            Message text
15656     char   *orig_tag        Original message if this one is a reply
15657     char   *reply_tag       Reply for current message
15658     char   *attachment1/2/3 File attachment
15659     char   *encoding        Encoding of message
15660     int    *size            Actual message text size
15661 
15662   Function value:
15663     EL_SUCCESS              Successful completion
15664     EL_LAST_MSG             Last message in log
15665 
15666 \********************************************************************/
15667 {
15668    int size, fh = 0, offset, search_status, rd;
15669    char str[256], *p;
15670    char message[10000], thread[256], attachment_all[256];
15671 
15672    if (tag[0]) {
15673       search_status = el_search_message(tag, &fh, TRUE);
15674       if (search_status != EL_SUCCESS)
15675          return search_status;
15676    } else {
15677       /* open most recent message */
15678       strcpy(tag, "-1");
15679       search_status = el_search_message(tag, &fh, TRUE);
15680       if (search_status != EL_SUCCESS)
15681          return search_status;
15682    }
15683 
15684    /* extract message size */
15685    offset = TELL(fh);
15686    rd = read(fh, str, 15);
15687    assert(rd == 15);
15688    
15689    /* make sure the input string is zero-terminated before we call atoi() */
15690    str[15] = 0;
15691 
15692    /* get size */
15693    size = atoi(str+9);
15694    
15695    assert(strncmp(str,"$Start$:",8) == 0);
15696    assert(size > 15);
15697    assert(size < sizeof(message));
15698    
15699    memset(message, 0, sizeof(message));
15700 
15701    rd = read(fh, message, size);
15702    assert(rd > 0);
15703    assert((rd+15 == size)||(rd == size));
15704 
15705    close(fh);
15706 
15707    /* decode message */
15708    if (strstr(message, "Run: ") && run)
15709       *run = atoi(strstr(message, "Run: ") + 5);
15710 
15711    el_decode(message, "Date: ",     date,     80); /* size from show_elog_submit_query() */
15712    el_decode(message, "Thread: ", thread, sizeof(thread));
15713    el_decode(message, "Author: ",   author,   80); /* size from show_elog_submit_query() */
15714    el_decode(message, "Type: ",     type,     80); /* size from show_elog_submit_query() */
15715    el_decode(message, "System: ",   system,   80); /* size from show_elog_submit_query() */
15716    el_decode(message, "Subject: ",  subject, 256); /* size from show_elog_submit_query() */
15717    el_decode(message, "Attachment: ", attachment_all, sizeof(attachment_all));
15718    el_decode(message, "Encoding: ", encoding, 80); /* size from show_elog_submit_query() */
15719 
15720    /* break apart attachements */
15721    if (attachment1 && attachment2 && attachment3) {
15722       attachment1[0] = attachment2[0] = attachment3[0] = 0;
15723       p = strtok(attachment_all, ",");
15724       if (p != NULL) {
15725          strcpy(attachment1, p);
15726          p = strtok(NULL, ",");
15727          if (p != NULL) {
15728             strcpy(attachment2, p);
15729             p = strtok(NULL, ",");
15730             if (p != NULL)
15731                strcpy(attachment3, p);
15732          }
15733       }
15734 
15735       assert(strlen(attachment1) < 256); /* size from show_elog_submit_query() */
15736       assert(strlen(attachment2) < 256); /* size from show_elog_submit_query() */
15737       assert(strlen(attachment3) < 256); /* size from show_elog_submit_query() */
15738    }
15739 
15740    /* conver thread in reply-to and reply-from */
15741    if (orig_tag != NULL && reply_tag != NULL) {
15742       p = strtok(thread, " \r");
15743       if (p != NULL)
15744          strcpy(orig_tag, p);
15745       else
15746          strcpy(orig_tag, "");
15747       p = strtok(NULL, " \r");
15748       if (p != NULL)
15749          strcpy(reply_tag, p);
15750       else
15751          strcpy(reply_tag, "");
15752       if (atoi(orig_tag) == 0)
15753          orig_tag[0] = 0;
15754       if (atoi(reply_tag) == 0)
15755          reply_tag[0] = 0;
15756    }
15757 
15758    p = strstr(message, "========================================\n");
15759 
15760    if (text != NULL) {
15761       if (p != NULL) {
15762          p += 41;
15763          if ((int) strlen(p) >= *textsize) {
15764             strncpy(text, p, *textsize - 1);
15765             text[*textsize - 1] = 0;
15766             return EL_TRUNCATED;
15767          } else {
15768             strcpy(text, p);
15769 
15770             /* strip end tag */
15771             if (strstr(text, "$End$"))
15772                *strstr(text, "$End$") = 0;
15773 
15774             *textsize = strlen(text);
15775          }
15776       } else {
15777          text[0] = 0;
15778          *textsize = 0;
15779       }
15780    }
15781 
15782    if (search_status == EL_LAST_MSG)
15783       return EL_LAST_MSG;
15784 
15785    return EL_SUCCESS;
15786 }
15787 
15788 
15789 /********************************************************************/
15790 INT el_search_run(int run, char *return_tag)
15791 /********************************************************************\
15792 
15793   Routine: el_search_run
15794 
15795   Purpose: Find first message belonging to a specific run
15796 
15797   Input:
15798     int    run              Run number
15799 
15800   Output:
15801     char   *tag             tag of retrieved message
15802 
15803   Function value:
15804     EL_SUCCESS              Successful completion
15805     EL_LAST_MSG             Last message in log
15806 
15807 \********************************************************************/
15808 {
15809    int actual_run, fh, status;
15810    char tag[256];
15811 
15812    tag[0] = return_tag[0] = 0;
15813 
15814    do {
15815       /* open first message in file */
15816       strcat(tag, "-1");
15817       status = el_search_message(tag, &fh, TRUE);
15818       if (status == EL_FIRST_MSG)
15819          break;
15820       if (status != EL_SUCCESS)
15821          return status;
15822       close(fh);
15823 
15824       if (strchr(tag, '.') != NULL)
15825          strcpy(strchr(tag, '.'), ".0");
15826 
15827       el_retrieve(tag, NULL, &actual_run, NULL, NULL,
15828                   NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
15829    } while (actual_run >= run);
15830 
15831    while (actual_run < run) {
15832       strcat(tag, "+1");
15833       status = el_search_message(tag, &fh, TRUE);
15834       if (status == EL_LAST_MSG)
15835          break;
15836       if (status != EL_SUCCESS)
15837          return status;
15838       close(fh);
15839 
15840       el_retrieve(tag, NULL, &actual_run, NULL, NULL,
15841                   NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
15842    }
15843 
15844    strcpy(return_tag, tag);
15845 
15846    if (status == EL_LAST_MSG || status == EL_FIRST_MSG)
15847       return status;
15848 
15849    return EL_SUCCESS;
15850 }
15851 
15852 
15853 /********************************************************************/
15854 INT el_delete_message(char *tag)
15855 /********************************************************************\
15856 
15857   Routine: el_submit
15858 
15859   Purpose: Submit an ELog entry
15860 
15861   Input:
15862     char   *tag             Message tage
15863 
15864   Output:
15865     <none>
15866 
15867   Function value:
15868     EL_SUCCESS              Successful completion
15869 
15870 \********************************************************************/
15871 {
15872 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
15873    INT n, size, fh, mutex, offset = 0, tail_size, status;
15874    char dir[256], str[256], file_name[256];
15875    HNDLE hDB;
15876    char *buffer = NULL;
15877 
15878    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
15879 
15880    /* request semaphore */
15881    cm_get_experiment_mutex(NULL, &mutex);
15882    ss_mutex_wait_for(mutex, 0);
15883 
15884    /* generate file name YYMMDD.log in data directory */
15885    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
15886 
15887    size = sizeof(dir);
15888    memset(dir, 0, size);
15889    status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Elog dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, FALSE);
15890    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
15891       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
15892 
15893    if (dir[0] != 0 && dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
15894       strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
15895 
15896    strcpy(str, tag);
15897    if (strchr(str, '.')) {
15898       offset = atoi(strchr(str, '.') + 1);
15899       *strchr(str, '.') = 0;
15900    }
15901    sprintf(file_name, "%s%s.log", dir, str);
15902    fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_RDWR | O_BINARY, 0644);
15903    if (fh < 0) {
15904       ss_mutex_release(mutex);
15905       return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15906    }
15907    lseek(fh, offset, SEEK_SET);
15908    read(fh, str, 16);
15909    size = atoi(str + 9);
15910 
15911    /* buffer tail of logfile */
15912    lseek(fh, 0, SEEK_END);
15913    tail_size = TELL(fh) - (offset + size);
15914 
15915    if (tail_size > 0) {
15916       buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(tail_size);
15917       if (buffer == NULL) {
15918          close(fh);
15919          ss_mutex_release(mutex);
15920          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15921       }
15922 
15923       lseek(fh, offset + size, SEEK_SET);
15924       n = read(fh, buffer, tail_size);
15925    }
15926    lseek(fh, offset, SEEK_SET);
15927 
15928    if (tail_size > 0) {
15929       n = write(fh, buffer, tail_size);
15930       M_FREE(buffer);
15931    }
15932 
15933    /* truncate file here */
15934 #ifdef OS_WINNT
15935    chsize(fh, TELL(fh));
15936 #else
15937    ftruncate(fh, TELL(fh));
15938 #endif
15939 
15940    /* if file length gets zero, delete file */
15941    tail_size = lseek(fh, 0, SEEK_END);
15942    close(fh);
15943 
15944    if (tail_size == 0)
15945       remove(file_name);
15946 
15947    /* release elog mutex */
15948    ss_mutex_release(mutex);
15949 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
15950 
15951    return EL_SUCCESS;
15952 }
15953 
15955 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
15956  /* end of elfunctionc */
15959 
15966 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
15967 
15968 /********************************************************************\
15969 *                                                                    *
15970 *                     Alarm functions                                *
15971 *                                                                    *
15972 \********************************************************************/
15973 
15974 /********************************************************************/
15975 BOOL al_evaluate_condition(char *condition, char *value)
15976 {
15977    HNDLE hDB, hkey;
15978    int i, j, index, size;
15979    KEY key;
15980    double value1, value2;
15981    char str[256], op[3], function[80];
15982    char data[10000];
15983    DWORD time;
15984 
15985    strcpy(str, condition);
15986    op[1] = op[2] = 0;
15987    value1 = value2 = 0;
15988    index = 0;
15989 
15990    /* find value and operator */
15991    for (i = strlen(str) - 1; i > 0; i--)
15992       if (strchr("<>=!", str[i]) != NULL)
15993          break;
15994    op[0] = str[i];
15995    value2 = atof(str + i + 1);
15996    str[i] = 0;
15997 
15998    if (i > 0 && strchr("<>=!", str[i - 1])) {
15999       op[1] = op[0];
16000       op[0] = str[--i];
16001       str[i] = 0;
16002    }
16003 
16004    i--;
16005    while (i > 0 && str[i] == ' ')
16006       i--;
16007    str[i + 1] = 0;
16008 
16009    /* check if function */
16010    function[0] = 0;
16011    if (str[i] == ')') {
16012       str[i--] = 0;
16013       if (strchr(str, '(')) {
16014          *strchr(str, '(') = 0;
16015          strcpy(function, str);
16016          for (i = strlen(str) + 1, j = 0; str[i]; i++, j++)
16017             str[j] = str[i];
16018          str[j] = 0;
16019          i = j - 1;
16020       }
16021    }
16022 
16023    /* find key */
16024    if (str[i] == ']') {
16025       str[i--] = 0;
16026       while (i > 0 && isdigit(str[i]))
16027          i--;
16028       index = atoi(str + i + 1);
16029       str[i] = 0;
16030    }
16031 
16032    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
16033    db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hkey);
16034    if (!hkey) {
16035       cm_msg(MERROR, "al_evaluate_condition",
16036              "Cannot find key %s to evaluate alarm condition", str);
16037       if (value)
16038          strcpy(value, "unknown");
16039       return FALSE;
16040    }
16041 
16042    if (equal_ustring(function, "access")) {
16043       /* check key access time */
16044       db_get_key_time(hDB, hkey, &time);
16045       sprintf(str, "%ld", time);
16046       value1 = atof(str);
16047    } else {
16048       /* get key data and convert to double */
16049       db_get_key(hDB, hkey, &key);
16050       size = sizeof(data);
16051       db_get_data(hDB, hkey, data, &size, key.type);
16052       db_sprintf(str, data, size, index, key.type);
16053       value1 = atof(str);
16054    }
16055 
16056    /* return value */
16057    if (value)
16058       strcpy(value, str);
16059 
16060    /* now do logical operation */
16061    if (strcmp(op, "=") == 0)
16062       return value1 == value2;
16063    if (strcmp(op, "==") == 0)
16064       return value1 == value2;
16065    if (strcmp(op, "!=") == 0)
16066       return value1 != value2;
16067    if (strcmp(op, "<") == 0)
16068       return value1 < value2;
16069    if (strcmp(op, ">") == 0)
16070       return value1 > value2;
16071    if (strcmp(op, "<=") == 0)
16072       return value1 <= value2;
16073    if (strcmp(op, ">=") == 0)
16074       return value1 >= value2;
16075 
16076    return FALSE;
16077 }
16078 
16080 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
16081 
16082 /********************************************************************/
16104 INT al_trigger_alarm(char *alarm_name, char *alarm_message, char *default_class,
16105                      char *cond_str, INT type)
16106 {
16107    if (rpc_is_remote())
16108       return rpc_call(RPC_AL_TRIGGER_ALARM, alarm_name, alarm_message,
16109                       default_class, cond_str, type);
16110 
16111 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
16112    {
16113       int status, size;
16114       HNDLE hDB, hkeyalarm;
16115       char str[256];
16116       ALARM alarm;
16117       BOOL flag;
16118       ALARM_ODB_STR(alarm_odb_str);
16119 
16120       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
16121 
16122       /* check online mode */
16123       flag = TRUE;
16124       size = sizeof(flag);
16125       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Online Mode", &flag, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
16126       if (!flag)
16127          return AL_SUCCESS;
16128 
16129       /* find alarm */
16130       sprintf(str, "/Alarms/Alarms/%s", alarm_name);
16131       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hkeyalarm);
16132       if (!hkeyalarm) {
16133          /* alarm must be an internal analyzer alarm, so create a default alarm */
16134          status = db_create_record(hDB, 0, str, strcomb(alarm_odb_str));
16135          db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hkeyalarm);
16136          if (!hkeyalarm) {
16137             cm_msg(MERROR, "al_trigger_alarm", "Cannot create alarm record");
16138             return AL_ERROR_ODB;
16139          }
16140 
16141          if (default_class && default_class[0])
16142             db_set_value(hDB, hkeyalarm, "Alarm Class", default_class, 32, 1, TID_STRING);
16143          status = TRUE;
16144          db_set_value(hDB, hkeyalarm, "Active", &status, sizeof(status), 1, TID_BOOL);
16145       }
16146 
16147       /* set parameters for internal alarms */
16148       if (type != AT_EVALUATED && type != AT_PERIODIC) {
16149          db_set_value(hDB, hkeyalarm, "Type", &type, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
16150          strcpy(str, cond_str);
16151          db_set_value(hDB, hkeyalarm, "Condition", str, 256, 1, TID_STRING);
16152       }
16153 
16154       size = sizeof(alarm);
16155       status = db_get_record(hDB, hkeyalarm, &alarm, &size, 0);
16156       if (status != DB_SUCCESS || alarm.type < 1 || alarm.type > AT_LAST) {
16157          /* make sure alarm record has right structure */
16158          db_check_record(hDB, hkeyalarm, "", strcomb(alarm_odb_str), TRUE);
16159 
16160          size = sizeof(alarm);
16161          status = db_get_record(hDB, hkeyalarm, &alarm, &size, 0);
16162          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16163             cm_msg(MERROR, "al_trigger_alarm", "Cannot get alarm record");
16164             return AL_ERROR_ODB;
16165          }
16166       }
16167 
16168       /* if internal alarm, check if active and check interval */
16169       if (alarm.type != AT_EVALUATED && alarm.type != AT_PERIODIC) {
16170          /* check global alarm flag */
16171          flag = TRUE;
16172          size = sizeof(flag);
16173          db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Alarm system active", &flag, &size, TID_BOOL,
16174                       TRUE);
16175          if (!flag)
16176             return AL_SUCCESS;
16177 
16178          if (!alarm.active)
16179             return AL_SUCCESS;
16180 
16181          if ((INT) ss_time() - (INT) alarm.checked_last < alarm.check_interval)
16182             return AL_SUCCESS;
16183 
16184          /* now the alarm will be triggered, so save time */
16185          alarm.checked_last = ss_time();
16186       }
16187 
16188       /* write back alarm message for internal alarms */
16189       if (alarm.type != AT_EVALUATED && alarm.type != AT_PERIODIC) {
16190          strncpy(alarm.alarm_message, alarm_message, 79);
16191          alarm.alarm_message[79] = 0;
16192       }
16193 
16194       /* now trigger alarm class defined in this alarm */
16195       if (alarm.alarm_class[0])
16196          al_trigger_class(alarm.alarm_class, alarm_message, alarm.triggered > 0);
16197 
16198       /* signal alarm being triggered */
16199       cm_asctime(str, sizeof(str));
16200 
16201       if (!alarm.triggered)
16202          strcpy(alarm.time_triggered_first, str);
16203 
16204       alarm.triggered++;
16205       strcpy(alarm.time_triggered_last, str);
16206 
16207       alarm.checked_last = ss_time();
16208 
16209       status = db_set_record(hDB, hkeyalarm, &alarm, sizeof(alarm), 0);
16210       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16211          cm_msg(MERROR, "al_trigger_alarm", "Cannot update alarm record");
16212          return AL_ERROR_ODB;
16213       }
16214 
16215    }
16216 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
16217 
16218    return AL_SUCCESS;
16219 }
16220 
16222 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
16223 
16224 /********************************************************************/
16225 INT al_trigger_class(char *alarm_class, char *alarm_message, BOOL first)
16226 /********************************************************************\
16227 
16228   Routine: al_trigger_class
16229 
16230   Purpose: Trigger a certain alarm class
16231 
16232   Input:
16233     char   *alarm_class     Alarm class, must be defined in
16234                             /alarms/classes
16235     char   *alarm_message   Optional message which goes with alarm
16236     BOOL   first            TRUE if alarm is triggered first time
16237                             (used for elog)
16238 
16239   Output:
16240 
16241   Function value:
16242     AL_INVALID_NAME         Alarm class not defined
16243     AL_SUCCESS              Successful completion
16244 
16245 \********************************************************************/
16246 {
16247    int status, size, state;
16248    HNDLE hDB, hkeyclass;
16249    char str[256], command[256], tag[32];
16250    ALARM_CLASS ac;
16251 
16252    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
16253 
16254    /* get alarm class */
16255    sprintf(str, "/Alarms/Classes/%s", alarm_class);
16256    db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hkeyclass);
16257    if (!hkeyclass) {
16258       cm_msg(MERROR, "al_trigger_class", "Alarm class %s not found in ODB", alarm_class);
16259       return AL_INVALID_NAME;
16260    }
16261 
16262    size = sizeof(ac);
16263    status = db_get_record(hDB, hkeyclass, &ac, &size, 0);
16264    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16265       cm_msg(MERROR, "al_trigger_class", "Cannot get alarm class record");
16266       return AL_ERROR_ODB;
16267    }
16268 
16269    /* write system message */
16270    if (ac.write_system_message &&
16271        (INT) ss_time() - (INT) ac.system_message_last > ac.system_message_interval) {
16272       sprintf(str, "%s: %s", alarm_class, alarm_message);
16273       cm_msg(MTALK, "al_trigger_class", str);
16274       ac.system_message_last = ss_time();
16275    }
16276 
16277    /* write elog message on first trigger */
16278    if (ac.write_elog_message && first)
16279       el_submit(0, "Alarm system", "Alarm", "General", alarm_class, str,
16280                 "", "plain", "", "", 0, "", "", 0, "", "", 0, tag, 32);
16281 
16282    /* execute command */
16283    if (ac.execute_command[0] &&
16284        ac.execute_interval > 0 &&
16285        (INT) ss_time() - (INT) ac.execute_last > ac.execute_interval) {
16286       sprintf(str, "%s: %s", alarm_class, alarm_message);
16287       sprintf(command, ac.execute_command, str);
16288       cm_msg(MINFO, "al_trigger_class", "Execute: %s", command);
16289       ss_system(command);
16290       ac.execute_last = ss_time();
16291    }
16292 
16293    /* stop run */
16294    if (ac.stop_run) {
16295       state = STATE_STOPPED;
16296       size = sizeof(state);
16297       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/State", &state, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
16298       if (state != STATE_STOPPED)
16299          cm_transition(TR_STOP, 0, NULL, 0, ASYNC, FALSE);
16300    }
16301 
16302    status = db_set_record(hDB, hkeyclass, &ac, sizeof(ac), 0);
16303    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16304       cm_msg(MERROR, "al_trigger_class", "Cannot update alarm class record");
16305       return AL_ERROR_ODB;
16306    }
16307 
16308    return AL_SUCCESS;
16309 }
16310 
16311 
16312 /********************************************************************/
16313 INT al_reset_alarm(char *alarm_name)
16314 /********************************************************************\
16315 
16316   Routine: al_reset_alarm
16317 
16318   Purpose: Reset (acknowledge) alarm
16319 
16320   Input:
16321     char   *alarm_name      Alarm name, must be defined in /Alarms/Alarms
16322                             If NULL reset all alarms
16323 
16324   Output:
16325     <none>
16326 
16327   Function value:
16328     AL_INVALID_NAME         Alarm name not defined
16329     AL_RESET                Alarm was triggered and reset
16330     AL_SUCCESS              Successful completion
16331 
16332 \********************************************************************/
16333 {
16334    int status, size, i;
16335    HNDLE hDB, hkeyalarm, hkeyclass, hsubkey;
16336    KEY key;
16337    char str[256];
16338    ALARM alarm;
16339    ALARM_CLASS ac;
16340 
16341    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
16342 
16343    if (alarm_name == NULL) {
16344       /* reset all alarms */
16345       db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Alarms", &hkeyalarm);
16346       if (hkeyalarm) {
16347          for (i = 0;; i++) {
16348             db_enum_link(hDB, hkeyalarm, i, &hsubkey);
16349 
16350             if (!hsubkey)
16351                break;
16352 
16353             db_get_key(hDB, hsubkey, &key);
16354             al_reset_alarm(key.name);
16355          }
16356       }
16357       return AL_SUCCESS;
16358    }
16359 
16360    /* find alarm and alarm class */
16361    sprintf(str, "/Alarms/Alarms/%s", alarm_name);
16362    db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hkeyalarm);
16363    if (!hkeyalarm) {
16364       cm_msg(MERROR, "al_reset_alarm", "Alarm %s not found in ODB", alarm_name);
16365       return AL_INVALID_NAME;
16366    }
16367 
16368    size = sizeof(alarm);
16369    status = db_get_record(hDB, hkeyalarm, &alarm, &size, 0);
16370    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16371       cm_msg(MERROR, "al_reset_alarm", "Cannot get alarm record");
16372       return AL_ERROR_ODB;
16373    }
16374 
16375    sprintf(str, "/Alarms/Classes/%s", alarm.alarm_class);
16376    db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hkeyclass);
16377    if (!hkeyclass) {
16378       cm_msg(MERROR, "al_reset_alarm", "Alarm class %s not found in ODB",
16379              alarm.alarm_class);
16380       return AL_INVALID_NAME;
16381    }
16382 
16383    size = sizeof(ac);
16384    status = db_get_record(hDB, hkeyclass, &ac, &size, 0);
16385    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16386       cm_msg(MERROR, "al_reset_alarm", "Cannot get alarm class record");
16387       return AL_ERROR_ODB;
16388    }
16389 
16390    if (alarm.triggered) {
16391       alarm.triggered = 0;
16392       alarm.time_triggered_first[0] = 0;
16393       alarm.time_triggered_last[0] = 0;
16394       alarm.checked_last = 0;
16395 
16396       ac.system_message_last = 0;
16397       ac.execute_last = 0;
16398 
16399       status = db_set_record(hDB, hkeyalarm, &alarm, sizeof(alarm), 0);
16400       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16401          cm_msg(MERROR, "al_reset_alarm", "Cannot update alarm record");
16402          return AL_ERROR_ODB;
16403       }
16404       status = db_set_record(hDB, hkeyclass, &ac, sizeof(ac), 0);
16405       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16406          cm_msg(MERROR, "al_reset_alarm", "Cannot update alarm class record");
16407          return AL_ERROR_ODB;
16408       }
16409       return AL_RESET;
16410    }
16411 
16412    return AL_SUCCESS;
16413 }
16414 
16415 
16416 /********************************************************************/
16417 INT al_check()
16418 /********************************************************************\
16419 
16420   Routine: al_scan
16421 
16422   Purpose: Scan ODB alarams and programs
16423 
16424   Input:
16425 
16426   Output:
16427 
16428   Function value:
16429     AL_SUCCESS              Successful completion
16430 
16431 \********************************************************************/
16432 {
16433    if (rpc_is_remote())
16434       return rpc_call(RPC_AL_CHECK);
16435 
16436 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
16437    {
16438       INT i, status, size, mutex;
16439       HNDLE hDB, hkeyroot, hkey;
16440       KEY key;
16441       ALARM alarm;
16442       char str[256], value[256];
16443       DWORD now;
16444       PROGRAM_INFO program_info;
16445       BOOL flag;
16446 
16447       ALARM_CLASS_STR(alarm_class_str);
16448       ALARM_ODB_STR(alarm_odb_str);
16449       ALARM_PERIODIC_STR(alarm_periodic_str);
16450 
16451       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
16452 
16453       if (hDB == 0)
16454          return AL_SUCCESS;     /* called from server not yet connected */
16455 
16456       /* check online mode */
16457       flag = TRUE;
16458       size = sizeof(flag);
16459       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Online Mode", &flag, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
16460       if (!flag)
16461          return AL_SUCCESS;
16462 
16463       /* check global alarm flag */
16464       flag = TRUE;
16465       size = sizeof(flag);
16466       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Alarm system active", &flag, &size, TID_BOOL, TRUE);
16467       if (!flag)
16468          return AL_SUCCESS;
16469 
16470       /* request semaphore */
16471       cm_get_experiment_mutex(&mutex, NULL);
16472       status = ss_mutex_wait_for(mutex, 100);
16473       if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
16474          return SUCCESS;        /* someone else is doing alarm business */
16475 
16476       /* check ODB alarms */
16477       db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Alarms", &hkeyroot);
16478       if (!hkeyroot) {
16479          /* create default ODB alarm */
16480          status =
16481              db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Alarms/Demo ODB", strcomb(alarm_odb_str));
16482          db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Alarms", &hkeyroot);
16483          if (!hkeyroot) {
16484             ss_mutex_release(mutex);
16485             return SUCCESS;
16486          }
16487 
16488          status =
16489              db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Alarms/Demo periodic",
16490                               strcomb(alarm_periodic_str));
16491          db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Alarms", &hkeyroot);
16492          if (!hkeyroot) {
16493             ss_mutex_release(mutex);
16494             return SUCCESS;
16495          }
16496 
16497          /* create default alarm classes */
16498          status =
16499              db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Classes/Alarm", strcomb(alarm_class_str));
16500          status =
16501              db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Alarms/Classes/Warning",
16502                               strcomb(alarm_class_str));
16503          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16504             ss_mutex_release(mutex);
16505             return SUCCESS;
16506          }
16507       }
16508 
16509       for (i = 0;; i++) {
16510          status = db_enum_key(hDB, hkeyroot, i, &hkey);
16511          if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
16512             break;
16513 
16514          db_get_key(hDB, hkey, &key);
16515 
16516          size = sizeof(alarm);
16517          status = db_get_record(hDB, hkey, &alarm, &size, 0);
16518          if (status != DB_SUCCESS || alarm.type < 1 || alarm.type > AT_LAST) {
16519             /* make sure alarm record has right structure */
16520             db_check_record(hDB, hkey, "", strcomb(alarm_odb_str), TRUE);
16521             size = sizeof(alarm);
16522             status = db_get_record(hDB, hkey, &alarm, &size, 0);
16523             if (status != DB_SUCCESS || alarm.type < 1 || alarm.type > AT_LAST) {
16524                cm_msg(MERROR, "al_check", "Cannot get alarm record");
16525                continue;
16526             }
16527          }
16528 
16529          /* check periodic alarm only when active */
16530          if (alarm.active &&
16531              alarm.type == AT_PERIODIC &&
16532              alarm.check_interval > 0 &&
16533              (INT) ss_time() - (INT) alarm.checked_last > alarm.check_interval) {
16534             /* if checked_last has not been set, set it to current time */
16535             if (alarm.checked_last == 0) {
16536                alarm.checked_last = ss_time();
16537                db_set_record(hDB, hkey, &alarm, size, 0);
16538             } else
16539                al_trigger_alarm(key.name, alarm.alarm_message, alarm.alarm_class, "",
16540                                 AT_PERIODIC);
16541          }
16542 
16543          /* check alarm only when active and not internal */
16544          if (alarm.active &&
16545              alarm.type == AT_EVALUATED &&
16546              alarm.check_interval > 0 &&
16547              (INT) ss_time() - (INT) alarm.checked_last > alarm.check_interval) {
16548             /* if condition is true, trigger alarm */
16549             if (al_evaluate_condition(alarm.condition, value)) {
16550                sprintf(str, alarm.alarm_message, value);
16551                al_trigger_alarm(key.name, str, alarm.alarm_class, "", AT_EVALUATED);
16552             } else {
16553                alarm.checked_last = ss_time();
16554                status = db_set_record(hDB, hkey, &alarm, sizeof(alarm), 0);
16555                if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16556                   cm_msg(MERROR, "al_check", "Cannot write back alarm record");
16557                   continue;
16558                }
16559             }
16560          }
16561       }
16562 
16563       /* check /programs alarms */
16564       db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Programs", &hkeyroot);
16565       if (hkeyroot) {
16566          for (i = 0;; i++) {
16567             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hkeyroot, i, &hkey);
16568             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
16569                break;
16570 
16571             db_get_key(hDB, hkey, &key);
16572 
16573             /* don't check "execute on xxx" */
16574             if (key.type != TID_KEY)
16575                continue;
16576 
16577             size = sizeof(program_info);
16578             status = db_get_record(hDB, hkey, &program_info, &size, 0);
16579             if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
16580                cm_msg(MERROR, "al_check", "Cannot get program info record");
16581                continue;
16582             }
16583 
16584             now = ss_time();
16585 
16586             rpc_get_name(str);
16587             str[strlen(key.name)] = 0;
16588             if (!equal_ustring(str, key.name) &&
16589                 cm_exist(key.name, FALSE) == CM_NO_CLIENT) {
16590                if (program_info.first_failed == 0)
16591                   program_info.first_failed = now;
16592 
16593                /* fire alarm when not running for more than what specified in check interval */
16594                if (now - program_info.first_failed >= program_info.check_interval / 1000) {
16595                   /* if not running and alarm calss defined, trigger alarm */
16596                   if (program_info.alarm_class[0]) {
16597                      sprintf(str, "Program %s is not running", key.name);
16598                      al_trigger_alarm(key.name, str, program_info.alarm_class,
16599                                       "Program not running", AT_PROGRAM);
16600                   }
16601 
16602                   /* auto restart program */
16603                   if (program_info.auto_restart && program_info.start_command[0]) {
16604                      ss_system(program_info.start_command);
16605                      program_info.first_failed = 0;
16606                      cm_msg(MTALK, "al_check", "Program %s restarted", key.name);
16607                   }
16608                }
16609             } else
16610                program_info.first_failed = 0;
16611 
16612             db_set_record(hDB, hkey, &program_info, sizeof(program_info), 0);
16613          }
16614       }
16615 
16616       ss_mutex_release(mutex);
16617    }
16618 #endif                          /* LOCAL_COUTINES */
16619 
16620    return SUCCESS;
16621 }
16622 
16624 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
16625  /* end of alfunctionc */
16627 
16628 /***** sKIP eb_xxx **************************************************/
16630 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
16631 /***** sKIP eb_xxx **************************************************/
16632 
16633 #if !defined(OS_VXWORKS)
16634 /********************************************************************\
16635 *                                                                    *
16636 *                 Event buffer functions                             *
16637 *                                                                    *
16638 \********************************************************************/
16639 
16640 /* PAA several modification in the eb_xxx()
16641    also new function eb_buffer_full()
16642 */
16643 static char *_event_ring_buffer = NULL;
16644 static INT _eb_size;
16645 static char *_eb_read_pointer, *_eb_write_pointer, *_eb_end_pointer;
16646 
16647 /********************************************************************/
16648 INT eb_create_buffer(INT size)
16649 /********************************************************************\
16650 
16651   Routine: eb_create_buffer
16652 
16653   Purpose: Create an event buffer. Has to be called initially before
16654            any other eb_xxx function
16655 
16656   Input:
16657     INT    size             Size in bytes
16658 
16659   Output:
16660     none
16661 
16662   Function value:
16663     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
16664     BM_NO_MEMEORY           Out of memory
16665 
16666 \********************************************************************/
16667 {
16668    _event_ring_buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(size);
16669    if (_event_ring_buffer == NULL)
16670       return BM_NO_MEMORY;
16671 
16672    memset(_event_ring_buffer, 0, size);
16673    _eb_size = size;
16674 
16675    _eb_write_pointer = _eb_read_pointer = _eb_end_pointer = _event_ring_buffer;
16676 
16677    _send_sock = rpc_get_event_sock();
16678 
16679    return CM_SUCCESS;
16680 }
16681 
16682 /********************************************************************/
16683 INT eb_free_buffer()
16684 /********************************************************************\
16685 
16686   Routine: eb_free_buffer
16687 
16688   Purpose: Free memory allocated voa eb_create_buffer
16689 
16690   Input:
16691     none
16692 
16693   Output:
16694     none
16695 
16696   Function value:
16697     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
16698 
16699 \********************************************************************/
16700 {
16701    if (_event_ring_buffer)
16702       M_FREE(_event_ring_buffer);
16703 
16704    _eb_size = 0;
16705    return CM_SUCCESS;
16706 }
16707 
16708 
16709 /********************************************************************/
16710 INT eb_free_space(void)
16711 /********************************************************************\
16712 
16713   Routine: eb_free_space
16714 
16715   Purpose: Compute and return usable free space in the event buffer
16716 
16717   Input:
16718     none
16719 
16720   Output:
16721     none
16722 
16723   Function value:
16724     INT    Number of usable free bytes in the event buffer
16725 
16726 \********************************************************************/
16727 {
16728    INT free;
16729 
16730    if (_event_ring_buffer == NULL) {
16731       cm_msg(MERROR, "eb_get_pointer", "please call eb_create_buffer first");
16732       return -1;
16733    }
16734 
16735    if (_eb_write_pointer >= _eb_read_pointer) {
16736       free = _eb_size - ((PTYPE) _eb_write_pointer - (PTYPE) _event_ring_buffer);
16737    } else if (_eb_write_pointer >= _event_ring_buffer) {
16738       free = (PTYPE) _eb_read_pointer - (PTYPE) _eb_write_pointer;
16739    } else if (_eb_end_pointer == _event_ring_buffer) {
16740       _eb_write_pointer = _event_ring_buffer;
16741       free = _eb_size;
16742    } else if (_eb_read_pointer == _event_ring_buffer) {
16743       free = 0;
16744    } else {
16745       _eb_write_pointer = _event_ring_buffer;
16746       free = (PTYPE) _eb_read_pointer - (PTYPE) _eb_write_pointer;
16747    }
16748 
16749    return free;
16750 }
16751 
16752 
16753 /********************************************************************/
16754 DWORD eb_get_level()
16755 /********************************************************************\
16756 
16757   Routine: eb_get_level
16758 
16759   Purpose: Return filling level of event buffer in percent
16760 
16761   Input:
16762     none
16763 
16764   Output:
16765     none
16766 
16767   Function value:
16768     DWORD level              0..99
16769 
16770 \********************************************************************/
16771 {
16772    INT size;
16773 
16774    size = _eb_size - eb_free_space();
16775 
16776    return (100 * size) / _eb_size;
16777 }
16778 
16779 
16780 /********************************************************************/
16781 BOOL eb_buffer_full(void)
16782 /********************************************************************\
16783 
16784   Routine: eb_buffer_full
16785 
16786   Purpose: Test if there is sufficient space in the event buffer
16787     for another event
16788 
16789   Input:
16790     none
16791 
16792   Output:
16793     none
16794 
16795   Function value:
16796     BOOL  Is there enough space for another event in the event buffer
16797 
16798 \********************************************************************/
16799 {
16800    INT free;
16801 
16802    free = eb_free_space();
16803 
16804    /* if max. event won't fit, return zero */
16805    return (free < MAX_EVENT_SIZE + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + sizeof(INT));
16806 }
16807 
16808 
16809 /********************************************************************/
16810 EVENT_HEADER *eb_get_pointer()
16811 /********************************************************************\
16812 
16813   Routine: eb_get_pointer
16814 
16815   Purpose: Get pointer to next free location in event buffer
16816 
16817   Input:
16818     none
16819 
16820   Output:
16821     none
16822 
16823   Function value:
16824     EVENT_HEADER *            Pointer to free location
16825 
16826 \********************************************************************/
16827 {
16828    /* if max. event won't fit, return zero */
16829    if (eb_buffer_full()) {
16830 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
16831       logMsg("eb_get_pointer(): Event won't fit: read=%d, write=%d, end=%d\n",
16832              _eb_read_pointer - _event_ring_buffer,
16833              _eb_write_pointer - _event_ring_buffer,
16834              _eb_end_pointer - _event_ring_buffer, 0, 0, 0);
16835 #endif
16836       return NULL;
16837    }
16838 
16839    /* leave space for buffer handle */
16840    return (EVENT_HEADER *) (_eb_write_pointer + sizeof(INT));
16841 }
16842 
16843 
16844 /********************************************************************/
16845 INT eb_increment_pointer(INT buffer_handle, INT event_size)
16846 /********************************************************************\
16847 
16848   Routine: eb_increment_pointer
16849 
16850   Purpose: Increment write pointer of event buffer after an event
16851            has been copied into the buffer (at an address previously
16852            obtained via eb_get_pointer)
16853 
16854   Input:
16855     INT buffer_handle         Buffer handle event should be sent to
16856     INT event_size            Event size in bytes including header
16857 
16858   Output:
16859     none
16860 
16861   Function value:
16862     CM_SUCCESS                Successful completion
16863 
16864 \********************************************************************/
16865 {
16866    INT aligned_event_size;
16867 
16868    /* if not connected remotely, use bm_send_event */
16869    if (_send_sock == 0)
16870       return bm_send_event(buffer_handle,
16871                            _eb_write_pointer + sizeof(INT), event_size, SYNC);
16872 
16873    aligned_event_size = ALIGN8(event_size);
16874 
16875    /* copy buffer handle */
16876    *((INT *) _eb_write_pointer) = buffer_handle;
16877    _eb_write_pointer += sizeof(INT) + aligned_event_size;
16878 
16879    if (_eb_write_pointer > _eb_end_pointer)
16880       _eb_end_pointer = _eb_write_pointer;
16881 
16882    if (_eb_write_pointer > _event_ring_buffer + _eb_size)
16883       cm_msg(MERROR, "eb_increment_pointer",
16884              "event size (%d) exeeds maximum event size (%d)", event_size,
16885              MAX_EVENT_SIZE);
16886 
16887    if (_eb_size - ((PTYPE) _eb_write_pointer - (PTYPE) _event_ring_buffer) <
16888        MAX_EVENT_SIZE + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + sizeof(INT)) {
16889       _eb_write_pointer = _event_ring_buffer;
16890 
16891       /* avoid rp==wp */
16892       if (_eb_read_pointer == _event_ring_buffer)
16893          _eb_write_pointer--;
16894    }
16895 
16896    return CM_SUCCESS;
16897 }
16898 
16899 
16900 /********************************************************************/
16901 INT eb_send_events(BOOL send_all)
16902 /********************************************************************\
16903 
16904   Routine: eb_send_events
16905 
16906   Purpose: Send events from the event buffer to the server
16907 
16908   Input:
16909     BOOL send_all             If FALSE, only send events if buffer
16910                               contains more than _opt_tcp_size bytes
16911 
16912   Output:
16913     none
16914 
16915   Function value:
16916     CM_SUCCESS                Successful completion
16917 
16918 \********************************************************************/
16919 {
16920    char *eb_wp, *eb_ep;
16921    INT size, i;
16922 
16923    /* write pointers are volatile, so make copy */
16924    eb_ep = _eb_end_pointer;
16925    eb_wp = _eb_write_pointer;
16926 
16927    if (eb_wp == _eb_read_pointer)
16928       return CM_SUCCESS;
16929    if (eb_wp > _eb_read_pointer) {
16930       size = (PTYPE) eb_wp - (PTYPE) _eb_read_pointer;
16931 
16932       /* don't send if less than optimal TCP buffer size available */
16933       if (size < (INT) _opt_tcp_size && !send_all)
16934          return CM_SUCCESS;
16935    } else {
16936       /* send last piece of event buffer */
16937       size = (PTYPE) eb_ep - (PTYPE) _eb_read_pointer;
16938    }
16939 
16940    while (size > _opt_tcp_size) {
16941       /* send buffer */
16942       i = send_tcp(_send_sock, _eb_read_pointer, _opt_tcp_size, 0);
16943       if (i < 0) {
16944          printf("send_tcp() returned %d\n", i);
16945          cm_msg(MERROR, "eb_send_events", "send_tcp() failed");
16946          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
16947       }
16948 
16949       _eb_read_pointer += _opt_tcp_size;
16950       if (_eb_read_pointer == eb_ep && eb_wp < eb_ep)
16951          _eb_read_pointer = _eb_end_pointer = _event_ring_buffer;
16952 
16953       size -= _opt_tcp_size;
16954    }
16955 
16956    if (send_all || eb_wp < _eb_read_pointer) {
16957       /* send buffer */
16958       i = send_tcp(_send_sock, _eb_read_pointer, size, 0);
16959       if (i < 0) {
16960          printf("send_tcp() returned %d\n", i);
16961          cm_msg(MERROR, "eb_send_events", "send_tcp() failed");
16962          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
16963       }
16964 
16965       _eb_read_pointer += size;
16966       if (_eb_read_pointer == eb_ep && eb_wp < eb_ep)
16967          _eb_read_pointer = _eb_end_pointer = _event_ring_buffer;
16968    }
16969 
16970    /* Check for case where eb_wp = eb_ring_buffer - 1 */
16971    if (eb_wp < _event_ring_buffer && _eb_end_pointer == _event_ring_buffer) {
16972       return CM_SUCCESS;
16973    }
16974 
16975    if (eb_wp != _eb_read_pointer)
16976       return BM_MORE_EVENTS;
16977 
16978    return CM_SUCCESS;
16979 }
16980 
16981 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS  eb section */
16982 
16984 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
16985 
16992 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
16993 
16994 /********************************************************************\
16995 *                                                                    *
16996 *                 Dual memory buffer functions                       *
16997 *                                                                    *
16998 * Provide a dual memory buffer scheme for handling front-end         *
16999 * event. This code as been requested for allowing contemporary       *
17000 * task handling a)acquisition, b)network transfer if possible.       *
17001 * The pre-compiler switch will determine the mode of operation.      *
17002 * if DM_DUAL_THREAD is defined in mfe.c, it is expected to have      *
17003 * a seperate task taking care of the dm_area_send                    *
17004 *                                                                    *
17005 * "*" : visible functions                                            *
17006 * dm_buffer_create():     *Setup the dual memory buffer              *
17007 *                          Setup semaphore                           *
17008 *                          Spawn second thread                       *
17009 * dm_buffer_release():    *Release memory allocation for dm          *
17010 *                          Force a kill of 2nd thread                *
17011 *                          Remove semaphore                          *
17012 * dm_area_full():         *Check for both area being full            *
17013 *                          None blocking, may be used for interrupt  *
17014 *                          disable.                                  *
17015 * dm_pointer_get()     :  *Check memory space and return pointer     *
17016 *                          Blocking function with timeout if no more *
17017 *                          space for next event. If error will abort.*
17018 * dm_pointer_increment(): *Move pointer to next free location        *
17019 *                          None blocking. performs bm_send_event if  *
17020 *                          local connection.                         *
17021 * dm_area_send():         *Transfer FULL buffer(s)                   *
17022 *                          None blocking function.                   *
17023 *                          if DUAL_THREAD: Give sem_send semaphore   *
17024 *                          else transfer FULL buffer                 *
17025 * dm_area_flush():        *Transfer all remaining events from dm     *
17026 *                          Blocking function with timeout            *
17027 *                          if DUAL_THREAD: Give sem_flush semaphore. *
17028 * dm_task():               Secondary thread handling DUAL_THREAD     *
17029 *                          mechanism. Serves 2 requests:             *
17030 *                          dm_send:  Transfer FULL buffer only.      *
17031 *                          dm_flush: Transfer ALL buffers.           *
17032 * dm_area_switch():        internal, used by dm_pointer_get()        *
17033 * dm_active_full():        internal: check space in current buffer   *
17034 * dm_buffer_send():        internal: send data for given area        *
17035 * dm_buffer_time_get():    interal: return the time stamp of the     *
17036 *                          last switch                               *
17037 \********************************************************************/
17038 
17039 #define DM_FLUSH       10       /* flush request for DUAL_THREAD */
17040 #define DM_SEND        11       /* FULL send request for DUAL_THREAD */
17041 #define DM_KILL        12       /* Kill request for 2nd thread */
17042 #define DM_TIMEOUT     13       /* "timeout" return state in flush request for DUAL_THREAD */
17043 #define DM_ACTIVE_NULL 14       /* "both buffer were/are FULL with no valid area" return state */
17044 
17045 typedef struct {
17046    char *pt;                    /* top pointer    memory buffer          */
17047    char *pw;                    /* write pointer  memory buffer          */
17048    char *pe;                    /* end   pointer  memory buffer          */
17049    char *pb;                    /* bottom pointer memory buffer          */
17050    BOOL full;                   /* TRUE if memory buffer is full         */
17051    DWORD serial;                /* full buffer serial# for evt order     */
17052 } DMEM_AREA;
17053 
17054 typedef struct {
17055    DMEM_AREA *pa;               /* active memory buffer */
17056    DMEM_AREA area1;             /* mem buffer area 1 */
17057    DMEM_AREA area2;             /* mem buffer area 2 */
17058    DWORD serial;                /* overall buffer serial# for evt order     */
17059    INT action;                  /* for multi thread configuration */
17060    DWORD last_active;           /* switch time stamp */
17061    HNDLE sem_send;              /* semaphore for dm_task */
17062    HNDLE sem_flush;             /* semaphore for dm_task */
17063 } DMEM_BUFFER;
17064 
17065 DMEM_BUFFER dm;
17066 INT dm_user_max_event_size;
17067 
17069 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
17070 
17071 /********************************************************************/
17079 INT dm_buffer_create(INT size, INT user_max_event_size)
17080 {
17081 
17082    dm.area1.pt = (char *) M_MALLOC(size);
17083    if (dm.area1.pt == NULL)
17084       return (BM_NO_MEMORY);
17085    dm.area2.pt = (char *) M_MALLOC(size);
17086    if (dm.area2.pt == NULL)
17087       return (BM_NO_MEMORY);
17088 
17089    /* check user event size against the system MAX_EVENT_SIZE */
17090    if (user_max_event_size > MAX_EVENT_SIZE) {
17091       cm_msg(MERROR, "dm_buffer_create", "user max event size too large");
17092       return BM_MEMSIZE_MISMATCH;
17093    }
17094    dm_user_max_event_size = user_max_event_size;
17095 
17096    memset(dm.area1.pt, 0, size);
17097    memset(dm.area2.pt, 0, size);
17098 
17099    /* initialize pointers */
17100    dm.area1.pb = dm.area1.pt + size - 1024;
17101    dm.area1.pw = dm.area1.pe = dm.area1.pt;
17102    dm.area2.pb = dm.area2.pt + size - 1024;
17103    dm.area2.pw = dm.area2.pe = dm.area2.pt;
17104 
17105   /*-PAA-*/
17106 #ifdef DM_DEBUG
17107    printf(" in dm_buffer_create ---------------------------------\n");
17108    printf(" %i %p %p %p %p\n", size, dm.area1.pt, dm.area1.pw, dm.area1.pe, dm.area1.pb);
17109    printf(" %i %p %p %p %p\n", size, dm.area2.pt, dm.area2.pw, dm.area2.pe, dm.area2.pb);
17110 #endif
17111 
17112    /* activate first area */
17113    dm.pa = &dm.area1;
17114 
17115    /* Default not full */
17116    dm.area1.full = dm.area2.full = FALSE;
17117 
17118    /* Reset serial buffer number with proper starting sequence */
17119    dm.area1.serial = dm.area2.serial = 0;
17120    /* ensure proper serial on next increment */
17121    dm.serial = 1;
17122 
17123    /* set active buffer time stamp */
17124    dm.last_active = ss_millitime();
17125 
17126    /* get socket for event sending */
17127    _send_sock = rpc_get_event_sock();
17128 
17129 #ifdef DM_DUAL_THREAD
17130    {
17131       INT status;
17132       VX_TASK_SPAWN starg;
17133 
17134       /* create semaphore */
17135       status = ss_mutex_create("send", &dm.sem_send);
17136       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
17137          cm_msg(MERROR, "dm_buffer_create", "error in ss_mutex_create send");
17138          return status;
17139       }
17140       status = ss_mutex_create("flush", &dm.sem_flush);
17141       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
17142          cm_msg(MERROR, "dm_buffer_create", "error in ss_mutex_create flush");
17143          return status;
17144       }
17145       /* spawn dm_task */
17146       memset(&starg, 0, sizeof(VX_TASK_SPAWN));
17147 
17148 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
17149       /* Fill up the necessary arguments */
17150       strcpy(starg.name, "areaSend");
17151       starg.priority = 120;
17152       starg.stackSize = 20000;
17153 #endif
17154 
17155       if ((status = ss_thread_create(dm_task, (void *) &starg))
17156           != SS_SUCCESS) {
17157          cm_msg(MERROR, "dm_buffer_create", "error in ss_thread_create");
17158          return status;
17159       }
17160 #ifdef OS_WINNT
17161       /* necessary for true MUTEX (NT) */
17162       ss_mutex_wait_for(dm.sem_send, 0);
17163 #endif
17164    }
17165 #endif                          /* DM_DUAL_THREAD */
17166 
17167    return CM_SUCCESS;
17168 }
17169 
17171 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
17172 
17173 /********************************************************************/
17174 INT dm_buffer_release(void)
17175 /********************************************************************\
17176   Routine: dm_buffer_release
17177 
17178   Purpose: Release dual memory buffers
17179   Input:
17180     none
17181   Output:
17182     none
17183   Function value:
17184     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
17185 \********************************************************************/
17186 {
17187    if (dm.area1.pt) {
17188       free(dm.area1.pt);
17189       dm.area1.pt = NULL;
17190    }
17191    if (dm.area2.pt) {
17192       free(dm.area2.pt);
17193       dm.area2.pt = NULL;
17194    }
17195    dm.serial = 0;
